Awakened Ball Python.description:
This nonvenomous snake's name comes from its tendency to curl into a ball when frightened, though most people know it for its hunting tactic of coiling around prey and crushing victims with its powerful muscles. Nonetheless, brave herpetologists sometimes keep ball pythons as pets.

Snakes come in an array of forms, from jungle-dwelling constrictors that wrap around their prey to venomous vipers with deadly bites. Regardless, all snakes consume their prey whole by unhinging their jaws and using powerful muscles to move the food down their throats and into their stomachs.

NeJvQpMPGMIfzdCG.description:
Trigger A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the ball python attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.

Effect The DC of the Escape check is increased by 2.
NeJvQpMPGMIfzdCG.name: Tighten Coils

Effect The ball python moves the creature into its coils, freeing its jaws to make attacks, then uses Constrict against the creature. The ball python's coils can hold one creature.
l6OEi0DzuPlz6OeT.name: Wrap in Coils

Awakened Ball Python.name: Awakened Ball Python

Awakened Giant Chameleon.description: Giant chameleons are legendary for their ability to change their skin color in response to their surroundings. Their eyes are capable of peering in different directions independently, making them almost as difficult to sneak up on as they are to notice in the first place.

qbn93YsujSFI6TMZ.description: The giant chameleon can change its coloration to match its surroundings. It doesn't need cover to attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} with a Stealth check.
qbn93YsujSFI6TMZ.name: Camouflage

sguXTwhSIa1swJ1p.description: If the giant chameleon hits a creature with a tongue Strike, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the giant chameleon. The target isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the giant chameleon's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue with an attack that hits AC 15 and deals at least 4 slashing damage. Though this doesn't deal any damage to the giant chameleon, it prevents it from using its tongue Strike until it regrows its tongue, which takes a week.
sguXTwhSIa1swJ1p.name: Tongue Grab

Awakened Giant Chameleon.name: Awakened Giant Chameleon

Awakened Giant Frilled Lizard.description:
Found in warm and tropical forests and savannas, these immense lizards are a deadly threat to the unsuspecting traveler. When they aren't sleeping or stalking prey, giant frilled lizards bask in the sunlight for hours at a time. Explorers sometimes mistakenly think them related to dragons due to their large size, elaborate neck frills (which, when displayed in a show of aggression and dominance, can be mistaken for wings), and ferocious hissing vocalizations used to frighten away creatures too large to eat.

A giant frilled lizard's primary food sources are oversized arthropods and other invertebrates, but it won't hesitate to augment its diet with vertebrates, including other lizards, monkeys, and just about anything it can fit into its mouth-even humanoids. Although capable of short bursts of speed, a giant frilled lizard normally lies perfectly still while hunting, hoping to ambush its prey.

Lizards have a wide range of appearances and abilities, but most share a basic reptilian shape-long tails, wide toothy mouths, and four legs. While a few species are capable of movement on two legs for short periods of time, most are strictly quadrupedal. The three species presented here represent the most common and well-known of the larger species.

ONIHyZ3rL5vCjJod.description:
The giant frilled lizard Strides. If it ends that Stride adjacent to at least one other creature, it suddenly displays its colorful neck frills and issues a frightening hiss. Each adjacent creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure).

The creature is then temporarily immune to Intimidating Display for 1 minute.
ONIHyZ3rL5vCjJod.name: Intimidating Display

Awakened Giant Frilled Lizard.name: Awakened Giant Frilled Lizard

Awakened Megalania.description: Megalanias, like their smaller cousins the giant monitor lizards, strike fast and use their powerful bite to grip their prey. They prefer to swallow their prey whole rather than risk others getting a bite of a hard-won meal.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.
Kd0WbBjbLnB9LgHa.name: Sickening Blow

YwSiVQSxOJRFAjSF.description:
The blighted leaf leshy transforms into a Small gnarled, rotted tree. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

cMGzubx06UkoCHhs.description: When a blighted leaf leshy dies, a burst of rotted compost explodes from its body, dealing @Damage[1d6[slashing],1d6[poison]]{1d6 slashing damage and 1d6 poison damage} to each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. This area then fills with blighted saplings, becoming difficult terrain until the saplings wither 24 hours later.
cMGzubx06UkoCHhs.name: Blightburst

69MZMQoPzOTaa0gd.description: The shark Swims up to its swim Speed, then Leaps vertically out of the water up to 15 feet high, making a Strike against a creature at any point during the jump (this lets it attack a creature within 20 feet of the water's surface). After the Strike, the shark splashes back down into the water.
69MZMQoPzOTaa0gd.name: Breach

UTQLyZ7H8eYOM5p5.description: The shark can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.
UTQLyZ7H8eYOM5p5.name: Blood Scent

udwDeWvmYlXlPUV3.description:
Requirements The shark hit with a jaws Strike on its most recent action this turn.

Effect The creature the shark hit takes @Damage[1d10[slashing]] damage
udwDeWvmYlXlPUV3.name: Savage

Bloody Vortex (3-4).hazardDisable: Slay Silaqui, or @Check[thievery|dc:17|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to pry the gem out of Silaqui followed by disrupting the gem's power by either breaking it (AC 15, Hardness 5, HP 25, BT 13) or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd level; counteract DC 15)
Bloody Vortex (3-4).hazardRoutine:
All creatures within 40 feet of the vortex except Silaqui are drawn toward it. They must attempt either a @Check[fortitude|dc:14] save or an @Check[athletics|dc:14|traits:action:swim] check to Swim with a DC of 14, with the following results.

Success The creature is not moved.

Failure The creature is moved 10 feet closer to the center of the vortex. If this causes the creature to reach the center square of the vortex, they are exposed to Consuming Maelstrom.

Critical Failure As failure, except the creature is moved 20 feet closer to the center of the vortex.
Bloody Vortex (3-4).name: Bloody Vortex (3-4)

Bloody Vortex (5-6).description: A bloody vortex violently draining into a crack of raw elemental energy, fueled by the curse of a sea devil oracle.
Bloody Vortex (5-6).hazardDisable: Slay Silaqui, or @Check[thievery|dc:20|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to pry the gem out of Silaqui followed by disrupting the gem's power by either breaking it (AC 18, Hardness 10, HP 45, BT 23) or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd level; counteract DC 19)
Bloody Vortex (5-6).hazardRoutine:
All creatures within 40 feet of the vortex except Silaqui are drawn toward it. They must attempt either a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save or an @Check[athletics|dc:17|traits:action:swim] check to Swim with a DC of 17, with the following results.

Success The creature is not moved.

Failure The creature is moved 10 feet closer to the center of the vortex. If this causes the creature to reach the center square of the vortex, they are exposed to Consuming Maelstrom.

Critical Failure As failure, except the creature is moved 20 feet closer to the center of the vortex.
Bloody Vortex (5-6).name: Bloody Vortex (5-6)

9104lsyfyht93ak0.description:
Trigger The ravener husk takes bludgeoning damage

Effect The ravener's brittle bones shatter, spraying bone shards everywhere. Every creature within a @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10-foot emanation} of the ravener husk takes @Damage[6d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic] save).
9104lsyfyht93ak0.name: Boneshatter

wvec977sf9tk4uj0.description:
The ravener husk breathes a torrent of void energy that deals @Damage[12d6[void]] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:40]{40-foot cone} (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save).

They can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.
wvec977sf9tk4uj0.name: Breath Weapon

Brittle Skeletal Horse.description:
Skeletal horses are sometimes used as mounts by other undead or monsters.

Made from bones held together by foul necromancy, skeletons are among the most common types of undead, found haunting old dungeons and forgotten cemeteries.

1AzFNDZFiaJxTAJf.description: Undead and creatures allied with them can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.q9nbyIF0PEBqMtYe]{Command} a skeletal steed without needing to attempt a skill check.
1AzFNDZFiaJxTAJf.name: Undead Steed

ohwAZH20CeE3uGMp.description: The horse Strides twice, with its Speed increased by 10 feet.
ohwAZH20CeE3uGMp.name: Gallop

Brittle Skeletal Horse.name: Brittle Skeletal Horse

7Dwwk4c4cBxweZKc.description: A mandragora can smell creatures with blood as an imprecise sense at a range of 30 feet, and it can smell demons, fey, and sorcerers with blood as a precise sense at a range of 30 feet.
7Dwwk4c4cBxweZKc.name: Blood Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet

IOvxdhkIi0W0wzzB.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The mandragora emits an unsettling shriek. Each non-mandragora creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is sickened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. As long as the creature remains sickened, this slowed condition value can't be reduced below 1.
IOvxdhkIi0W0wzzB.name: Piercing Shriek

Xlbal6st53Tv5z83.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage and stupefied 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage and stupefied 1 (1 round)
Xlbal6st53Tv5z83.name: Bruorsivi Sap Infusion

eTTWHexqpmKAYC0k.description:
Requirements The mandragora has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The mandragora drains blood from the creature it has grabbed, dealing [[/r {2d6}]]{2d6 damage}. If the creature is a demon, fey, or sorcerer, the mandragora gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt.

A creature that has its blood drained by a mandragora is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing of any kind or amount.
eTTWHexqpmKAYC0k.name: Blood Drain

GHUyWzx0e2bkkF12.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half-plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

aFBLWbZSpOnYygCn.description:
Requirements The burned-out efreeti has one hand free

Effect The burned-out efreeti makes a melee Strike while keeping one hand free. If the Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in the efreeti's free hand.
aFBLWbZSpOnYygCn.name: Combat Grab

toA1G1C9IA05uuPQ.name: Plane Shift (At Will) (to Astral Plane, Elemental Planes, or Material Plane only)

uwN4vfr3npnwlu1S.description: When the burned-out efreeti Grabs a creature, that creature takes @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage, then takes 1d6 fire damage at the end of each of its turns as long as it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.
uwN4vfr3npnwlu1S.name: Burning Grasp

Chaotic Door (1-2).description: The frame splinters as the door flings open, the force hitting those nearby.
Chaotic Door (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[athletics|dc:17|name:Hold the Door Shut|traits:chaotic,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to hold the door shut against the force, or @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Relieve Door Pressure|traits:chaotic,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to deftly relieve pressure from the door.
Chaotic Door (1-2).name: Chaotic Door (1-2)

Chaotic Door (3-4).description: The frame splinters as the door flings open, the force hitting those nearby.
Chaotic Door (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[athletics|dc:20|name:Hold the Door Shut|traits:chaotic,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to hold the door shut against the force, or @Check[thievery|dc:21|name:Relieve Door Pressure|traits:chaotic,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to deftly relieve pressure from the door.
Chaotic Door (3-4).name: Chaotic Door (3-4)

5GAwFJvEq6KExgHC.description:
Trigger A creature that the giant crab can see targets the crab with an attack

Effect The giant crab scuttles to the side and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. After the attack resolves, the crab can Stride up to its speed in a straight line as part of the reaction.
5GAwFJvEq6KExgHC.name: Scuttle

6kfuZGeG5GJHb5wP.description: If a creature critically succeeds at a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the giant crab, the crab is flipped over onto its back in addition to the usual effects. A giant crab flipped onto its back has a particularly hard time defending itself; instead of taking the normal -2 circumstance penalty to AC for being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, it takes a -4 circumstance penalty to AC.
6kfuZGeG5GJHb5wP.name: Vulnerable to Prone

EFJbwURtmwbvaitP.description: Chesjilawa can see normally through mist, fog, and all forms of precipitation. She ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition caused by such effects. She ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from snow and ice and doesn't risk falling when crossing such terrain.
EFJbwURtmwbvaitP.name: Winter Wise

HcnRFHeoFQphRmRs.description: A mirror of ice forms around Chesjilawa's hand or wand as she focuses her magic into a more physical form, the better to damage creatures who can resist the cold. If her next action is to Cast a Spell that deals cold damage, the mirror shatters into a blitz of ice shards, changing half of the spell's damage from cold to slashing.
HcnRFHeoFQphRmRs.name: Mirrorshard Spell

S6mS8emZbzRo8WV3.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.j8vIoIEWElvpwkcI]{Mirror Image}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated level.

Craft Requirements Supply a listed-level casting of the spell.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.
S6mS8emZbzRo8WV3.name: Wand of Mirror Image (Level 2)

i64w2e9G0PytAjR5.description:
Icy flowers bloom around Chesjilawa as she instantly transports herself in a flurry of snow to a space within 120 feet that she can see. The destination must contain ice or snow.

She then can't Snow Step for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.
i64w2e9G0PytAjR5.name: Snow Step

0QxEUJDERK7Lezr8.description:

If her next action is to Cast a Spell that deals cold damage, the mirror shatters into a blitz of ice shards, changing half of the spell's damage from cold to slashing.

Churning Lava (1-2).description: The equilibrium of the brown mold and lava river is disturbed, creating bubbles of molten stone that burst and spew burning debris.
Churning Lava (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[nature|dc:14|name:Clear mold] or @Check[survival|dc:14|name:Clear mold] or @Check[thievery|dc:17|name:Clear mold] to clear your square and all adjacent squares of the mold; the churning lava does not target creatures in cleared squares with its spatter attack, but the hazard is not destroyed until every square has been cleared of mold.
Churning Lava (1-2).hazardReset: If not completely destroyed, the mold spreads to one additional square within 10 feet of lava each day until it fully regenerates and regains its state of equilibrium. If every square is cleaned of mold, the hazard is destroyed.
Churning Lava (1-2).hazardRoutine: (1 action) On the its initiative, the churning lava targets a random creature in the area with a ranged spatter attack as a magma bubble bursts.
Churning Lava (1-2).name: Churning Lava (1-2)

Churning Lava (3-4).description: The equilibrium of the brown mold and lava river is disturbed, creating bubbles of molten stone that burst and spew burning debris.
Churning Lava (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[nature|dc:17|name:Clear mold] or @Check[survival|dc:17|name:Clear mold] or @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Clear mold] to clear your square and all adjacent squares of the mold; the churning lava does not target creatures in cleared squares with its spatter attack, but the hazard is not destroyed until every square has been cleared of mold.
Churning Lava (3-4).hazardReset: If not completely destroyed, the mold spreads to one additional square within 10 feet of lava each day until it fully regenerates and regains its state of equilibrium. If every square is cleaned of mold, the hazard is destroyed.
Churning Lava (3-4).hazardRoutine: (1 action) On the its initiative, the churning lava targets a random creature in the area with a ranged spatter attack as a magma bubble bursts.
Churning Lava (3-4).name: Churning Lava (3-4)

Clouded Quartz (5-6).description:
Insatiable scavengers stalking the eternal gloom of the Darklands, cavern trolls consume all in their path-even rocks and minerals when more nourishing sustenance is scarce. These rocky goliaths can tunnel through stone with their iron-sharp claws.

Cavern trolls rarely venture to the surface world, for they have a debilitating vulnerability to sunlight that petrifies them on sustained contact. Unlike common trolls, cavern trolls can regenerate wounds dealt by fire. The crystalline nature of their skin, however, permits sonic attacks to neutralize their signature regeneration.

As cavern trolls age, their flinty skin becomes studded with small crystals and stones of various composition. Paragons of their kind have toothy maws replete with large, crystalline fangs. A typical cavern troll stands 14 feet in height and weighs about 2,000 pounds.

40gYFH2MsCS36FWP.description: 10 feet. Clouded Quartz is surrounded by a perpetual storm. The whirling winds impose a -2 circumstance penalty on ranged attack rolls using physical ammunition that target her or originate from her.
40gYFH2MsCS36FWP.name: Perpetual Storm Aura

BczEX9fZ2q5qXxKI.description: Clouded Quartz can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 10 feet. She can leave a tunnel if she desires.
BczEX9fZ2q5qXxKI.name: Rock Tunneler

FqhlwNyFsYxtpGNp.description: Clouded Quartz can see perfectly through wind and water. She never takes penalties to Perception from wind, rain, fog, or other precipitation, or from looking through water or being underwater, and such conditions don't cause anything to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from her.
FqhlwNyFsYxtpGNp.name: Tempest Sight

tuQ8FrXL4iChAQA1.description: If exposed to direct sunlight, Clouded Quartz immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions or Trample. The slowed value increases by 1 each time she ends her turn in sunlight. If Clouded Quartz's actions are reduced to 0 in this way, she becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} until she spends at least 1 minute in darkness. Spells like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.a3aQxCpoj1q1NQxC]{Sunburst} that create magical sunlight cannot petrify Clouded Quartz, but she's slowed 1 for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} after being exposed to such an effect.
tuQ8FrXL4iChAQA1.name: Sunlight Petrification

Clouded Quartz (5-6).name: Clouded Quartz (5-6)

The slowed value increases by 1 each time she ends her turn in sunlight. If Clouded Quartz's actions are reduced to 0 in this way, she becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} until she spends at least 1 minute in darkness. Cobbleswarm (B5).description:
Cobble mites resemble squarish stones a few inches across with mouths like split geodes. Though indolent and harmless alone, they're dangerous in large groups.

Busy road builders might unknowingly use cobble mites in construction.

MdAaSnMbM5KOAlWl.description: Each foe in the cobbleswarm's space takes @Damage[2d4[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save).
MdAaSnMbM5KOAlWl.name: Pummeling Assault

deXYiHJyBjDSNFF5.description:
The cobbleswarm attempts an @Check[athletics] check and compares the result to the Fortitude DC of each creature in its space. This counts as two attacks for the cobbleswarm's multiple attack penalty.

Critical Success The creature falls prone, takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the cobbleswarm until the end of the cobbleswarm's next turn.

Success The creature falls prone.
deXYiHJyBjDSNFF5.name: Grasping Bites

jmLRUmx1Vp2TnZd6.description: A cobbleswarm's tremorsense is a precise sense out to 40 feet and an imprecise sense out to 80 feet. A cobbleswarm can't sense anything beyond the range of its tremorsense.
jmLRUmx1Vp2TnZd6.name: Tremorsense (Precise) 40 feet, (Imprecise) 80 feet

Cobbleswarm (B5).name: Cobbleswarm (B5)

Collapsing Cabinet (1-2).description:
Fluids from leaking beakers have eaten nearly through the supports holding up this cabinet.

This Broken Threshold for this trap is 5, not 10.
Collapsing Cabinet (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:15|name:Support Cabinet|traits:mechanical,trap] (trained) to gently place something under the cabinet to support its weight.
Collapsing Cabinet (1-2).name: Collapsing Cabinet (1-2)

Collapsing Cabinet (3-4).description:
Fluids from leaking beakers have eaten nearly through the supports holding up this cabinet.

This Broken Threshold for this trap is 10, not 20.
Collapsing Cabinet (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Support Cabinet|traits:mechanical,trap] (trained) to gently place something under the cabinet to support its weight.
Collapsing Cabinet (3-4).name: Collapsing Cabinet (3-4)

Collapsing Ice.description: The ice here is weak and collapses under the weight of a Small or larger creature.
Collapsing Ice.hazardDisable: 2 @Check[crafting|dc:19|name:Create Ice Brace] to create a makeshift device to brace the ice.
Collapsing Ice.name: Collapsing Ice

Collapsing Ramp (7-8).description: Abyssal fire hits the stone beneath the ramp, causing a 15-foot-long section of it to collapse.
Collapsing Ramp (7-8).hazardDisable: @Check[crafting|dc:28] (expert) to stabilize the masonry. Each attempt takes 2 actions.
Collapsing Ramp (7-8).name: Collapsing Ramp (7-8)

Collapsing Ramp (9-10).description: Abyssal fire hits the stone beneath the ramp, causing a 15-foot-long section of it to collapse.
Collapsing Ramp (9-10).hazardDisable: @Check[crafting|dc:31] (expert) to stabilize the masonry. Each attempt takes 2 actions.
Collapsing Ramp (9-10).name: Collapsing Ramp (9-10)

Commoner (PFS 2-13).description:
Though not every commoner is downtrodden, many live hard lives of toil as they work to keep their families fed and housed in relative comfort. While many commoners are just simple folks who keep to themselves, sometimes commoners rebel, either rising up to face their oppressors or persuaded or even duped into joining nefarious plans and criminal conspiracies. Commoners benefit from power in numbers, and a crowd of commoners can accomplish a great deal more than their rulers often expect.

Unfortunately, every society has people living on its fringes. While good communities work to grant aid and respite to their downtrodden, sometimes-due to economic downturn, famine, or war-the ranks of the less fortunate exceed the community's capacity to support them. In heartless neutral and evil societies, poverty is seen as an inevitability that can never be truly eradicated, or even worse, as a tool to be manipulated for political gain.

T3ZpHsIT64RGyhT0.description: When three or more commoners are adjacent to each other each commoner gets a +1 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, attack rolls, and damage rolls.
T3ZpHsIT64RGyhT0.name: Power of the Mob

Commoner (PFS 2-13).name: Commoner (PFS 2-13)

DdBcbOs69kmUVmkm.description: When the corrupted wildfire successfully strikes a creature with an attack that deals persistent fire damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical hit). This condition cannot be reduced below 1 while the creature is subject to the persistent fire damage from the attack, and ends automatically when the persistent fire ends.
DdBcbOs69kmUVmkm.name: Filthy Burn

K2357WczpsewBpx1.description:
The burning sap that makes up the corrupted wildfire's body sputters and pops, ejecting a cloud of acrid that smoke in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] that lasts for 1 round.

This smoke provides concealment to all creatures within, and deals @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage to any creature that enters or begins its turn in the cloud (@Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic]).

A creature that fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).
K2357WczpsewBpx1.name: Acrid Cloud

llP0iPm4qwoX8UZ6.description: The corrupted wildfire ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

DdBcbOs69kmUVmkm.description: When the corrupted wildfire successfully strikes a creature with an attack that deals persistent fire damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical hit). K2357WczpsewBpx1.description:
The burning sap that makes up the corrupted wildfire's body sputters and pops, ejecting a cloud of acrid that smoke in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] that lasts for 1 round.

This smoke provides concealment to all creatures within, and deals @Damage[2d4[poison]] damage to any creature that enters or begins its turn in the cloud (@Check[fortitude|dc:22|basic]).

A creature that fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).
K2357WczpsewBpx1.name: Acrid Cloud

A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

Trigger The ravener husk takes bludgeoning damage

Effect The ravener's brittle bones shatter, spraying bone shards everywhere. Every creature within a @Template[emanation|distance:10] of the ravener husk takes @Damage[5d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save).
h4kxce1ykzfzk439.name: Boneshatter

zn75w61xdsrsbp0f.description:
The ravener husk breathes a torrent of void energy that deals @Damage[11d6[void]] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:40]{40-foot cone} (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save).

They can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.
zn75w61xdsrsbp0f.name: Breath Weapon

9HRRnXQ7UNOEMvDD.description: If exposed to direct sunlight, the cyclops bodak can't use actions with the death trait and it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the cyclops bodak ends its turn in sunlight. If the bodak loses all its actions this way, it is destroyed.
9HRRnXQ7UNOEMvDD.name: Sunlight Vulnerability

ZgCTtYIP3bHhvsfZ.description:
The cyclops bodak stares at a living creature within 30 feet that it can sense with its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.sebk9XseMCRkDqRg]{Lifesense}. That creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save. If the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained}, the bodak gains a number of temporary Hit Points equal to 5 times the value of the drained condition the target gained.

Multiple exposures to this ability can increase a creature's drained condition to a maximum of 4. If the cyclops bodak is destroyed, any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed} condition a creature has gained from Death Gaze are removed.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is doomed 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.
ZgCTtYIP3bHhvsfZ.name: Death Gaze

rM8TcwgNXsJXgzLQ.description: Any humanoid who dies while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed} by a cyclops bodak rises as an autonomous @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.Actor.jCJUvzs1FaL6PAkq]{Bodak} 24 hours after its death.
rM8TcwgNXsJXgzLQ.name: Bodak Spawn

wfYvmKHkGU8nKveB.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The cyclops bodak is about to roll a d20

Effect The bodak peers into an occluded spectrum of all possible futures. It gets a success (but not a critical success) on the roll instead of rolling.
wfYvmKHkGU8nKveB.name: Flash of Insight

8oo2FMRiAfqgyzxl.description: This satchel includes 50 feet of rope, pulleys, a dozen pitons, a hammer, a grappling hook, and one set of crampons. Climbing kits allow you to attach yourself to the wall you're Climbing, moving half as quickly as usual (minimum 5 feet) but letting you attempt a @Check[flat|dc:5] whenever you critically fail to prevent a fall. A single kit has only enough materials for one climber; each climber needs their own kit.

J2jz17JAQtHVQs5I.description: The Daughter Of Cocytus Enforcer deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Laex9xerP0tAva7M.description: On the first round of combat, if the Daughter Of Cocytus Enforcer rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to them.
Laex9xerP0tAva7M.name: Surprise Attack

OzTxpPbEz9oZ7Oxz.description: When the Daughter Of Cocytus Enforcer Strides half their speed or less, that movement does not trigger reactions.
OzTxpPbEz9oZ7Oxz.name: Mobility

Z0t8QDkJcFQRjjzs.description:
Activate 1 Interact

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.7UL8belWmo7U5YGM]{Effect: Darkvision Elixir (Lesser)}

Zaoq375hCaGrFG5e.description:
You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.
Zaoq375hCaGrFG5e.name: Thieves' Tools

sDwLsrlMceRxlzIo.description: The Daughter Of Cocytus Enforcer isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 4th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking, or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.w6rMqmGzhUahdnA7]{Surprise Attack}.
sDwLsrlMceRxlzIo.name: Deny Advantage

zS04tb23VRw9X9kX.description:

Effect The Daughter Of Cocytus Enforcer gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
zS04tb23VRw9X9kX.name: Nimble Dodge

1gLrx7OTMtRPbK9N.description:
The Daughter of Cocytus grunt's brutality shakes foes' confidence.

When the Daughter of Cocytus grunt deals damage on a critical hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, and the Daughter of Cocytus grunt can knock the target up to 10 feet away (this is forced movement).
1gLrx7OTMtRPbK9N.name: Brutal Beating

VQPPHF2M9xHf5XD3.description: The Daughter of Cocytus grunt deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

qy60SQR1jiyW4CXc.description:
Trigger The Daughter of Cocytus grunt has one hand free, and its target is within reach of that hand.

Effect The Daughter of Cocytus grunt makes a melee Strike while keeping one hand free. If this Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of the ruffian's next turn or until it leaves the Daughter of Cocytus grunt's reach, whichever comes first.

BAuZ1IxZQx0YoNQE.description: If the Daughter of Cocytus tough is within reach of an enemy, and that enemy is also within reach of at least two of her allies, that enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against her attacks.
BAuZ1IxZQx0YoNQE.name: Gang Up

VMpe0Uf0ZyQ89FMY.description:
The Daughter of Cocytus tough's brutality shakes foes' confidence and may disorient them.

When the Daughter of Cocytus tough deals damage on a critical hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, and it must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of the tough's next turn.

VQPPHF2M9xHf5XD3.description: The Daughter of Cocytus tough deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

8qLsjjKefZX3z28i.name: Powerful Jumper

W2DmmcacVVfMzKKI.description: The bulette attempts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}. If it's adjacent to an enemy at the apex of its High Jump or at the end of its Long Jump, it can make a claw Strike against the enemy at that moment. If the bulette jumps at least 5 feet vertically or at least 20 feet horizontally, it can attempt two claw Strikes instead of one. The bulette's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until it has made all the claw Strikes that are part of its Leaping Charge.
W2DmmcacVVfMzKKI.name: Leaping Charge

vGThkFmJksPhr6zI.description: A bulette gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attack and damage rolls with its jaws against a specific type of creature designated as its favorite food. Unless otherwise stated, a bulette's favored prey is halflings. Elves are never a favored prey for bulettes
vGThkFmJksPhr6zI.name: Favored Prey

1LFcOVY8d1aK048n.description: Requirements The demonplague zombie has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.
1LFcOVY8d1aK048n.name: Jaws

cGT0TWHmgl9A1bCP.description:
An infected creature can't cure conditions given by demonplague until it has been cured of the disease

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} and stupefied 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 Fatigued and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} (1 day)

Stage 5 dead, rising as a demonplague zombie immediately.
cGT0TWHmgl9A1bCP.name: Demonplague

dqSVqf9TqBvqPh9G.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
dqSVqf9TqBvqPh9G.name: Slow

ImEauJvx5theWLHA.description: A crawling hand can be assigned a quarry by anointing the hand with a drop of the intended quarry's blood. If the hand ever has no quarry, it automatically gains the next creature it damages as its quarry. The hand gains a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seeks} its quarry, to Survival checks when it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Tracks} its quarry, and damage rolls when it Strikes its quarry.
ImEauJvx5theWLHA.name: Mark Quarry

R8ajLDqmU0HyK0q7.description:
Trigger The giant crawling hand takes piercing or slashing damage

Effect A random creature adjacent to the giant crawling hand is sprayed with vile pus that deals @Damage[2d6[void]] damage. The affected creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:19|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}.
R8ajLDqmU0HyK0q7.name: Pus Burst

3Y0DD3yigmZsYOwO.description: If the next action the Disciple of Urxehl takes is to Cast a Spell, any creature that has taken damage from Urxehl's firestorm since the Disciple's last turn takes a -2 circumstance penalty to AC and saves against the spell.
3Y0DD3yigmZsYOwO.name: Channel Firestorm

ZKEB9TXW3zTrnq2F.description:
Trigger Urxehl's firestorm targets a creature

Effect The Disciple of Urxehl redirects the firestorm, causing it to target a different creature of the Disciple's choice.
ZKEB9TXW3zTrnq2F.name: Urxehl's Grace

The dragon forest rot breathes a toxic cloud that deals @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:15] (@Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic] save).

It can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.
WDttWBnICVwt2mYo.name: Breath Weapon

b3SbLDyYjM3QmXhM.description: 20 feet. A creature that enters or starts its turn in the emanation must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. On a critical failure, the creature also takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to the of all dragon forest rots for 1 minute.
b3SbLDyYjM3QmXhM.name: Stench

nmiINLl4XQwyT4oE.description: If the forest rot takes fire damage, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its turn.
nmiINLl4XQwyT4oE.name: Flame-Scorched

oEduKuW4WaDIp98Z.description:
Trigger An adjacent creature damages the dragon forest rot.

Effect The dragon forest rot sprays spores on the triggering creature. The spores deal @Damage[(2d4+5)[piercing]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:19|basic] save. On a critical failure, the triggering creature gains weakness to slashing 5 for the next 4 rounds.
oEduKuW4WaDIp98Z.name: Spores

Dragon's Death (1-2).description: The pile of bones transforms into a Large silver dragon, while the PCs appear to transform into dark, shadowy figures of alien physique. The dragon's flesh appears to slowly dissolve into lines of black smoke, which trail away toward the PCs and appear to be absorbed into their bodies. Once the dragon is stripped of flesh, its skeleton explodes in a shower of bone fragments.
Dragon's Death (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[religion|dc:20|name:Exorcise the Spirit|traits:haunt] (trained) to exorcise the spirit (two actions), or @Check[diplomacy|dc:23|name:Calm the Spirit|traits:haunt] (trained) to calm the spirit momentarily (two actions).
Dragon's Death (1-2).hazardReset: 1 minute, as the bone fragments slowly move back into a neat pile with the skull on top.
Dragon's Death (1-2).hazardRoutine:
Trigger A creature comes within 15 feet of the dragon skull

Effect All living creatures within 20 feet of the nest are peppered with bone shards and take @Damage[(2d10+7)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|name:Dragon's Death|traits:haunt,divine,necromancy] save).
Dragon's Death (1-2).name: Dragon's Death (1-2)

Dragon's Death (3-4).description: The pile of bones transforms into a Large silver dragon, while the PCs appear to transform into dark, shadowy figures of alien physique. The dragon's flesh appears to slowly dissolve into lines of black smoke, which trail away toward the PCs and appear to be absorbed into their bodies. Once the dragon is stripped of flesh, its skeleton explodes in a shower of bone fragments.
Dragon's Death (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[religion|dc:23|name:Exorcise the Spirit|traits:haunt] (trained) to exorcise the spirit (two actions), or @Check[diplomacy|dc:26|name:Calm the Spirit|traits:haunt] (trained) to calm the spirit momentarily (two actions).
Dragon's Death (3-4).hazardReset: 1 minute, as the bone fragments slowly move back into a neat pile with the skull on top.
Dragon's Death (3-4).hazardRoutine:
Trigger A creature comes within 15 feet of the dragon skull

Effect All living creatures within 20 feet of the nest are peppered with bone shards and take @Damage[(4d8+10)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Dragon's Death|traits:haunt,divine,necromancy] save).

On a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for [[/br 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours}.

This long, hollow proboscis is harvested from the notorious bloodseeker beast and drips a trickle of blood.

When you activate the beak, you deal an extra 1d4 precision damage on your damage roll. If you deal sneak attack damage to the creature, you also deal @Damage[1d4[bleed]].

Z48JRCf4URMUM0Q9.description: When Drandle Dreng rolls a success on a Reflex save, they get a critical success instead.

eVFl2ekbi0JK6bf5.description: This polished wooden ring constantly refreshes your body and mind. You don't need to eat or drink while wearing it, and you need only 2 hours of sleep per day to gain the benefits of 8 hours of sleep. A ring of sustenance doesn't function until it's been worn and invested continuously for a week. Removing it resets this interval.

Z7jlJMUOEYWNRyEf.description: A draugr's attacks spatter their targets with rancid flesh and rotting seaweed. A creature damaged by a draugr's Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).
Z7jlJMUOEYWNRyEf.name: Grotesque Gift

uKVy7brV5DJqD14v.description: The draugr makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within its melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A counts as two attacks for the draugr's multiple attack penalty.
uKVy7brV5DJqD14v.name: Swipe

x3UFyZwCCZPJ4YMT.description: A creature that slays a draugr is subjected to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]{Mariner's Curse} spell with a save DC of 20. The curse ends if the draugr is buried in a calm sea or after 1 week passes.
x3UFyZwCCZPJ4YMT.name: The Sea's Revenge

3YaoRTg7JFZbGJQg.description:
Requirements The duergar raider has manacles in hand and is adjacent to a creature

Effect The duergar raider makes an attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+8 #Shackle Attack]]{+8 modifier} against the target's AC to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the manacles. On a success, they apply the manacles.
3YaoRTg7JFZbGJQg.name: Shackle

ehGPcGg59UAn28oY.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Duergar Raider.npcAllSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

Electric Lock Rune.description: An invisible rune imprinted on a chest's lock releases a powerful electrical discharge.
Electric Lock Rune.hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Scratch Out the Rune] (expert) to scratch out the rune without allowing electricity to flow, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd level; counteract DC 18) to counteract the rune
Electric Lock Rune.name: Electric Lock Rune

M3na0AbE4UOQCZSq.description:
Like normal objects, the anatomical model has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the model takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once an anatomical model is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 19.
M3na0AbE4UOQCZSq.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 5)

RVJNNG5muHCPqqnR.description: A creature hit by the anatomical model's guts attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until it takes an action to remove the guts. A creature critically hit by the anatomical model's guts attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes}.
RVJNNG5muHCPqqnR.name: Slimy Guts

Ember Fox (PFS 2-14).description: Ember foxes resemble their canid namesakes, save for the flames that make their fur and the tips of their long whiskers flicker and glow.

JlQUb1sbsYfmz5Vi.description:
Trigger An adjacent ally is targeted by an effect that deals fire damage

Effect The ember fox drapes itself across its ally, granting the ally fire resistance 10 against the incoming attack.
JlQUb1sbsYfmz5Vi.name: Cloak in Embers

Ember Fox (PFS 2-14).name: Ember Fox (PFS 2-14)

Empowered Blood (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Scratch Out Runes] (untrained) to scratch out enough runes to disrupt the magic or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (1st level; counteract DC 15) to counteract the runes.
Empowered Blood (1-2).hazardReset: The hazard resets at the beginning of each round until it is disabled

85kxXW17gvaJu9KH.description: When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released. Adjacent creatures take @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:15|basic] save.
85kxXW17gvaJu9KH.name: Explosive Death

Explosive Monolith (3-4).description: A burst of abyssal energy ignites the sap in a nearby bruorsivi, which explodes in a burst of fiery splinters.
Explosive Monolith (3-4).hazardDisable:
@Check[arcana|dc:17], @Check[occultism|dc:17], or @Check[religion|dc:17] to magically alter the runes, or @Check[thievery|dc:20] to physically alter them. A PC that can read Abyssal or Cyclops is better able to identify key runes, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to these check (+2 if they speak both).

Each check requires two actions, and disabling the monolith requires three successful checks. A PC that critically succeeds earns two success. On a failed check, the attempting PC is exposed to the burning flames wreathing the monolith, taking @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage(@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|name:Explosive Monolith]).
Explosive Monolith (3-4).hazardRoutine:
(1 action) On the hazard's turn, randomly select a PC within 40 feet of the monolith. A tree near that PC explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:10], dealing @Damage[1d6[piercing],1d6[fire]]{1d6 piercing damage and 1d6 fire damage}. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17|name:Explosive Monolith|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.
Explosive Monolith (3-4).name: Explosive Monolith (3-4)

Explosive Monolith (5-6).hazardDisable:
@Check[arcana|dc:20], @Check[occultism|dc:20], or @Check[religion|dc:20] to magically alter the runes, or @Check[thievery|dc:23] to physically alter them. A PC that can read Abyssal or Cyclops is better able to identify key runes, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to these check (+2 if they speak both).

Each check requires two actions, and disabling the monolith requires three successful checks. A PC that critically succeeds earns two success. On a failed check, the attempting PC is exposed to the burning flames wreathing the monolith, taking @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|name:Explosive Monolith]).
Explosive Monolith (5-6).hazardRoutine:
(1 action) On the hazard's turn, randomly select a PC within 40 feet of the monolith. A tree near that PC explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:10], dealing @Damage[2d6[piercing],2d6[fire]]{2d6 piercing damage and 2d6 fire damage}. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20|name:Explosive Monolith|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.
Explosive Monolith (5-6).name: Explosive Monolith (5-6)

Famished Mimic.description:
Thought to be the result of a failed experiment meant to animate objects or a sinister alghollthu creation, mimics are clever monsters that can take the form of common manufactured objects. Mimics are ambush predators and voracious eaters, surprising their prey through their uncanny ability to mimic the form of common furniture and miscellany. They remain disguised until unsuspecting adventurers happen by, then they lash out in ambush.

Mimics possess complex alien minds, and while often cruel and self-serving, they also enjoy conversation with their prey from time to time. For unknown reasons, they are especially interested in humanoids. Mimics have a strong dislike for others of their kind and tend to live alone. A mimic can remain in its alternate form for an extremely long period of time, sometimes remaining disguised in a dungeon chamber for decades. Regardless of how long it waits, the mimic remains vigilant and alert, ready to strike at any moment.

91iOrkVbzeP7cK2M.description:
The mimic is coated in an adhesive slime. Any creature that hits the mimic, is hit by the mimic, or otherwise touches the mimic must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} (Escape DC 21). A weapon that hits the mimic is stuck to the mimic and can be removed with a successful @Check[athletics|dc:23] check (made as a single action).

A mimic can have any number of objects or creatures stuck to it at a time. The mimic can release a stuck creature or object by using a single action, and the adhesive dissolves 1 minute after the mimic dies, releasing all stuck objects and creatures.
91iOrkVbzeP7cK2M.name: Adhesive

M3QwWIU2rzRHWndo.description: The mimic assumes the shape of any Medium object. This doesn't change the mimic's texture or overall size but can alter its coloration and visual appearance. It has an automatic result of 26 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as the object that it's mimicking.
M3QwWIU2rzRHWndo.name: Mimic Object

Ns2pok7e6UtuKUd6.description:
Trigger A creature touches or physically interacts with the mimic while the mimic is transformed using Mimic Object.

Effect The triggering creature is automatically stuck by the mimic's adhesive (it receives no save). The mimic then makes a pseudopod Strike against any creature adjacent to the mimic.

Object Lesson can't be used again until the mimic escapes and takes on a new disguise.
Ns2pok7e6UtuKUd6.name: Object Lesson

qGVF829Lwi4ZemA9.name: Dwelling Lore (applies only to the dungeon it lives in)

Famished Mimic.name: Famished Mimic

Fence (PFS 2-00).description:
The longer criminals hold on to stolen loot, the greater the chance they will get caught. Fences make themselves indispensable in the underworld by paying for stolen goods in order to resell them later, whether through a seemingly legitimate business or to a closed group of elite buyers.

Some criminals are the desperate who have no option but to break the law to survive, while others choose a life of crime for thrills, forming gangs or underworld guilds that specialize in certain illegal ventures.

0WoLHxcEDfHig6LB.description: When the fence successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feints}, their target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the fence's attacks until the end of the fence's next turn. On a critical success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against all attacks until the end of the fence's next turn.
0WoLHxcEDfHig6LB.name: Scoundrel's Feint

CBVdyLeHnsGw5evo.description:
Activate A Interact

With a sharp twist of this item, you instantly create a screen of thick, opaque smoke in a burst centered on one corner of your space. All creatures within that area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

The radius of the burst is 5 feet.
CBVdyLeHnsGw5evo.name: Smokestick (Lesser)

USUUbgjaNlr0tqdX.description:
Activate 1 Interact

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.7UL8belWmo7U5YGM]{Effect: Darkvision Elixir (Lesser)}

blPj44XSQdjiu1MS.description: Fences live by their ability to recognize a viable trade. They can use Underworld Lore to identify an item's value and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.eReSHVEPCsdkSL4G]{Identify Magic} on an item. They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Underworld Lore checks when doing so, and to Underworld Lore checks to determine whether an item was stolen, whether a stolen item would be too recognizable to easily move, and who would be interested in purchasing such an item.
blPj44XSQdjiu1MS.name: Fence's Eye

cMz56RGF3H0a0ZQi.description: The fence always has a few items close at hand. The fence @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interacts} to draw a weapon or item that takes a single action to activate, and then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strikes} with the weapon or activates the item.
cMz56RGF3H0a0ZQi.name: Quick Rummage

pA5rSYohIHad8O4a.description:
You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.
pA5rSYohIHad8O4a.name: Thieves' Tools

ttSdjINAYV0VxPZk.description: The fence deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

ye3X09juCQpFV4T2.description: This small wooden box contains cosmetics, false facial hair, spirit gum, and a few simple wigs. You usually need a disguise kit to set up a disguise in order to Impersonate someone using the Deception skill. If you've crafted a large number of disguises, you can replenish your cosmetics supply with replacement cosmetics suitable for the type of your disguise kit.

Fence (PFS 2-00).name: Fence (PFS 2-00)

8SVJAkGeub65XLkC.description: The grindylow moves up to 60 feet in a straight line through the water without triggering reactions. It can use this ability while grabbing a creature.
8SVJAkGeub65XLkC.name: Jet

MBoQQVoF3ws3HLwy.description:
Trigger A creature attempts a melee attack against a zombie grindylow with a bludgeoning or slashing weapon

Effect The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:15] saving throw or become tangled in the kelp that surrounds the zombie grindylow, giving the creature a -10 circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it spends a manipulate action to remove the kelp.
MBoQQVoF3ws3HLwy.name: Tangling Kelp

UUaxUn8e1vkuaaXd.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
UUaxUn8e1vkuaaXd.name: Slow

yG0DUDJ68F3sYK7P.description:
When a grindylow Grabs a creature larger than itself, it attaches to that creature. The grabbed creature is not immobilized, but if it moves, the grindylow moves with it.

If the creature is Medium or smaller, it takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds while the grindylow is attached. The grindylow is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while it is attached to a creature.
yG0DUDJ68F3sYK7P.name: Clinging Suckers

W6noQhWuklyayC1t.description:
A fire-eye zombie can launch its eye at foes. While its eye is out of its head, the fire-eye zombie is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}.

At the end of its turn, a fire-eye zombie's eye flies back into its eye socket.
W6noQhWuklyayC1t.name: Eye Throwing

WCbXOYW55njv5jXG.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
WCbXOYW55njv5jXG.name: Slow

10 feet. The fire-eye zombie emits an aura of heat that causes open wounds to sizzle.

Creatures critically hit by the fire-eye zombie's Strikes must attempt this saving throw immediately.

NSrkmgeoEIMlRGQY.description:
A fire-eye zombie can launch its eye at foes. While its eye is out of its head, the fire-eye zombie is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}.

At the end of its turn, a fire-eye zombie's eye flies back into its eye socket.
NSrkmgeoEIMlRGQY.name: Eye Throwing

3g2l9ydocvf28khl.description: A brimorak's hooves and any weapon they wield burst into flame, dealing an extra @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage with each hit. If they don't have a weapon, they can create a flaming sword of fire and steel (see flaming sword Strike in Melee entry above).
3g2l9ydocvf28khl.name: Flaming Weapon

7ullxbvs8wpmjlzq.description: Smoke doesn't impair a brimorak's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.
7ullxbvs8wpmjlzq.name: Smoke Vision

a3d0hy3dj9u9pntm.description: Each time an adjacent creature deals slashing or piercing damage to the brimorak, the attacker is sprayed with the brimorak's boiling blood, which deals @Damage[3d4[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save).
a3d0hy3dj9u9pntm.name: Boiling Blood

c52mxlmgfax2xrkf.description: The brimorak emits a cloud of thick black smoke in a @Template[burst|distance:10]{10-foot burst} that remains in place for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. All creatures within the smoke become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the smoke become concealed to creatures within it. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the smoke it must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).
c52mxlmgfax2xrkf.name: Fume

fzrpqq4mvr4g5s36.description: Dousing a brimorak with water, either ordinary water or from a water effect, causes no physical harm to the fiend but deals @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage. Fully immersing the brimorak in water deals @Damage[5d6[mental]] damage per round.
fzrpqq4mvr4g5s36.name: Extinguishing Aversion

ornom9b33sn8mps5.description:
The brimorak spits their boiling blood in a @Template[line|distance:20]{20-foot line} that deals @Damage[8d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save).

The brimorak can't use their Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

The ground within this area becomes slippery, with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Wu0xFpewMKRK3HG8]{Grease} spell targeting an area until it's cleaned up or the brimorak is able to use their Breath Weapon again, whichever comes first.
ornom9b33sn8mps5.name: Breath Weapon

Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).description: The demon lord Urxehl manifests upon Golarion a small region of his Abyssal realm, filled with constantly burning forests lashed by fierce storms and unholy rain that only further feeds the flames. This is a mystical fire, fueled by the presence of Urxehl's minions. Any flames on the map emit concealing smoke in a 10-foot radius around the fire.
Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[nature|dc:17] or @Check[performance|dc:17] (trained) to remind the Finadar forest of its true self; or @Check[religion|dc:17], @Check[occultism|dc:17], or @Check[demon-lore|dc:17]{Demon Lore}(trained) to disrupt the connection to the imposed realm and extinguish one of the five sections of flames on the map. These checks can only be attempted by creatures adjacent to the section, and each attempt takes 2 actions. An extinguished fire still emits concealing smoke for 1 additional round but is no longer hot enough to deal damage. A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} spell or a spell with the water trait (2nd level; counteract DC 15) extinguishes a section of flames. If the PCs disable three of the five sections of the flames of Verakivhan, the hazard is too weakened to sustain itself, and the remaining flames disappear. If there are no demons or elementals remaining in the area, the hazard is automatically disabled.
Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).hazardRoutine: (3 actions) Any creature within the flames takes @Damage[(1d6+3)[fire]] damage, and any creature adjacent to the flames takes @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|name:Flames of Verakivhan|traits:fire] save). Additionally, the flames call down a fiery rain that deals @Damage[(1d6+3)[fire]] damage to a random PC within the planar overlay (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|name:Flames of Verakivhan|traits:fire] save). If any PCs attempted to disable the hazard that turn, the fiery rain chooses one of them as its target.
Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).name: Flames of Verakivhan (3-4)

Flames of Verakivhan (5-6).description: The demon lord Urxehl manifests upon Golarion a small region of his Abyssal realm, filled with constantly burning forests lashed by fierce storms and unholy rain that only further feeds the flames. This is a mystical fire, fueled by the presence of Urxehl's minions. Any flames on the map emit concealing smoke in a 10-foot radius around the fire.
Flames of Verakivhan (5-6).hazardDisable: @Check[nature|dc:20] or @Check[performance|dc:20] (trained) to remind the Finadar forest of its true self; or @Check[religion|dc:20], @Check[occultism|dc:20], or @Check[demon-lore|dc:20]{Demon Lore}(trained) to disrupt the connection to the imposed realm and extinguish one of the five sections of flames on the map. These checks can only be attempted by creatures adjacent to the section, and each attempt takes 2 actions. A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} spell or a spell with the water trait (2nd level; counteract DC 17) extinguishes a section of flames. If the PCs disable three of the five sections of the flames of Verakivhan, the hazard is too weakened to sustain itself, and the remaining flames disappear. If there are no demons or elementals remaining in the area, the hazard is automatically disabled.

Additionally, the flames call down a fiery rain that deals @Damage[(1d10+6)[fire]] damage to a random PC within the planar overlay (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|name:Flames of Verakivhan|traits:fire] save). If any PCs attempted to disable the hazard that turn, the fiery rain chooses one of them as its target.
Flames of Verakivhan (5-6).name: Flames of Verakivhan (5-6)

eFeUEWJ1TjADrQjO.description: When the flaming eye dies, it explodes in a violent burst of flame, dealing @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:14|basic] save) to creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:5].
eFeUEWJ1TjADrQjO.name: Explode

eFeUEWJ1TjADrQjO.description: When the flaming eye dies, it explodes in a violent burst of flame, dealing @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save) to creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:5].
eFeUEWJ1TjADrQjO.name: Explode

5 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save.

Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to for 1 minute.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.
32sJ45kKGClodunO.name: Smoldering Stench

Flooding Monolith (3-4).description: A surge of abyssal energy creates a powerful wave pushing away from the monolith.
Flooding Monolith (3-4).hazardDisable:
@Check[arcana|dc:18], @Check[occultism|dc:18], or @Check[religion|dc:18] to magically alter the runes, or @Check[thievery|dc:21] to physically alter them. A PC that can read Abyssal or Cyclops is better able to identify key runes, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to these check (+2 if they speak both).

Each check requires two actions, and disabling the monolith requires three successful checks. A PC that critically succeeds earns two success. On a failed check, the attempting PC is exposed to the burning flames wreathing the monolith, taking @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|name:Flooding Monolith] save).
Flooding Monolith (3-4).hazardRoutine:
(1 action) On the hazard's turn it sends a wave of water along the fork of the river (North, South, or East) that contains the nearest PC. Any creature along that fork in or on the surface of the water must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:18|name:Flooding Monolith] save.

The monolith's guardians are accustomed to these surges and are immune to this effect.

Critical Success The creature takes advantage of the undertow after the surge to reposition themselves. The creature can Step, ignoring difficult terrain caused by the water.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is pushed 10 feet away from the monolith.

Critical Failure The creature is pushed 15 feet away from the monolith and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
Flooding Monolith (3-4).name: Flooding Monolith (3-4)

Flooding Monolith (5-6).description: A surge of abyssal energy creates a powerful wave pushing away from the monolith.
Flooding Monolith (5-6).hazardDisable: @Check[arcana|dc:22], @Check[occultism|dc:22], or @Check[religion|dc:22] to magically alter the runes, or @Check[thievery|dc:25] to physically alter them. A PC that can read Abyssal or Cyclops is better able to identify key runes, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to these check (+2 if they speak both). Each check requires two actions, and disabling the monolith requires three successful checks. A PC that critically succeeds earns two success. On a failed check, the attempting PC is exposed to the burning flames wreathing the monolith, taking @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save).

The monolith's guardians are accustomed to these surges and are immune to this effect.

Critical Success The creature takes advantage of the undertow after the surge to reposition themselves. The creature can Step, ignoring difficult terrain caused by the water.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is pushed 10 feet away from the monolith.

Critical Failure The creature is pushed 15 feet away from the monolith and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
Flooding Monolith (5-6).name: Flooding Monolith (5-6)

Foretold Ruin (1-2).description: Daemonic curses slither and crawl through malevolent runes carved in four stone pillars. HP is per-pillar.
Foretold Ruin (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:17|name:Disable Thievery] (trained) to scratch out a pillar's runes, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (1st level; counteract DC 15) to counteract a pillar's magic, or @Check[athletics|dc:18|name:Disable Athletics|traits:action:force-open]{Athletics (Force Open)} to push a pillar over. Disabling a pillar requires two actions. Disabling all four pillars or slaying Sezruth disables the trap
Foretold Ruin (1-2).hazardRoutine:
Routine (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each disabled pillar. On its initiative, the trap uses each action to afflict a different non-evil creature in the room with thirst. The creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:17|name:Foretold Ruin|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is temporarily immune to additional negative effects from the foretold ruin hazard's reaction for 24 hours. The hazard has no awareness of this immunity and continues to target this creature.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} until they drink water. If the creature was already fatigued, they take @Damage[1d6[nonlethal,mental]]{1d6 nonlethal mental} damage.

Critical Failure The creature is fatigued until they drink water and takes 1d6 nonlethal mental damage. If the creature was already fatigued, they instead take @Damage[2d6[nonlethal,mental]]{2d6 nonlethal mental} damage.
Foretold Ruin (1-2).name: Foretold Ruin (1-2)

Foretold Ruin (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Disable Thievery] (trained) to scratch out a pillar's runes, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd level; counteract DC 18) to counteract a pillar's magic, or @Check[athletics|dc:21|name:Disable Athletics|traits:action:force-open]{Athletics (Force Open)} to push a pillar over. Disabling a pillar requires two actions. Disabling all four pillars or slaying Sezruth disables the trap
Foretold Ruin (3-4).hazardRoutine:
Routine (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each disabled pillar. On its initiative, the trap uses each action to afflict a different non-evil creature in the room with thirst. The creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:20|name:Foretold Ruin|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is temporarily immune to additional negative effects from the foretold ruin hazard's reaction for 24 hours. The hazard has no awareness of this immunity and continues to target this creature.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Critical Failure The creature is fatigued until they drink water and takes 1d6 nonlethal mental damage. If the creature was already fatigued, they instead take @Damage[2d6[nonlethal,mental]]{2d6 nonlethal mental} damage.

G6iIf6shT68NDbTW.description: A frost troll hunter isn't impeded by difficult terrain caused by snow or ice, nor do they need to attempt Acrobatics checks to keep from falling on slippery ice.
G6iIf6shT68NDbTW.name: Ice Stride

OPBJuHhEVoiEk4mU.description: The frost troll hunter's feet and weapons move in tandem. They can either Step and then Strike, or Strike and then Step.
OPBJuHhEVoiEk4mU.name: Skirmish Strike

hvk3jTMWT9RaDiBH.description: The frostbitten trollhound deals an extra 1d4 damage to creatures within reach of at least two of its allies.
hvk3jTMWT9RaDiBH.name: Pack Attack

viQYjDAyUKgEOmaJ.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:16]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 Enfeebled 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 day)

Stage 5 Enfeebled 2, Clumsy 2, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)
viQYjDAyUKgEOmaJ.name: Bloodfire Fever

iwRD5iTmlbMyJBRF.description:
Requirements The giant worker ant has a Large or smaller creature grabbed

Effect The giant worker ant Strides up to its full Speed, carrying the grabbed creature with it. It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered} if the grabbed creature is Medium or larger.
iwRD5iTmlbMyJBRF.name: Haul Away

OgeeLdGttAsxjjCc.description: This broad-bladed sword, sometimes called the hand-and-a-half sword, has a longer grip so it can be held in one hand or used with two hands to provide extra piercing or slashing power.

Wduouw2belSvL4Xj.description: Glorzia gains a +3 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures she has grabbed.
Wduouw2belSvL4Xj.name: Mauler

XEB79A5dsQFX25yf.description: Glorzia Strides up to 10 feet and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a creature she's undetected by. If she succeeds, she also deals fist damage to that creature.
XEB79A5dsQFX25yf.name: Bushwhack

UGJPxqKMa0aKLBWa.description: Explorer's clothing is sturdy enough that it can be reinforced to protect you, even though it isn't a suit of armor. It comes in many forms, though the most common sorts look like clerical vestments, monk's garments, or wizard's robes, as members of all three classes are likely to avoid wearing armor.

7vmhgd9oifizfpwo.description: The hand of Urxehl begins with 4 fingers embedded outside of the rift. At the beginning of the encounter, the hand is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1}, and can use this additional action to make grasping claw Strikes. For every 45 damage the hand of Urxehl takes, one of these fingers recedes and the hand loses 1 action, first losing the quickened condition, then becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} before being defeated at 0 Hit Points.
7vmhgd9oifizfpwo.name: Grasping Fingers

Trigger The hand takes enough damage to lose an action

Effect the hand thrashes about in pain, causing a minor earthquake. Creatures within 60 feet of the portal must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:28] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
