Hands of Slow Death.description: A pile of dust and bone meal, several inches deep and 10 feet across on each side, blocks the tunnel to the surface. It is suffused with the despair of the slowly dying, and summons vengeful skeletal hands to hunt down anyone who dares attempt to leave the area.
Hands of Slow Death.hazardDisable:
@Check[religion|dc:15|name:Administer Burial Rites|traits:haunt] (trained) to speak the proper burial rites, @Check[occultism|dc:15|name:Exorcise Spirits|traits:haunt] (trained) to exorcise the lingering souls, or @Check[intimidation|dc:17|name:Scare Away Spirits|traits:haunt] to scare the fearful souls away.

These actions have the verbal trait. Each check to disable the hazard requires 2 actions, and two total successes are required to disable the haunt.
Hands of Slow Death.hazardReset: The haunt deactivates if no creatures remain within 30 feet but resets immediately thereafter unless disabled. If tthe haunt is disabled, it resets after 24 hours.
Hands of Slow Death.hazardRoutine: (1 action) Spectral hands grasp at creatures in the area. Each creature within 30 feet of the dust pile takes @Damage[1d4[void]] damage (@Check[will|dc:17|basic|name:Grasping Hands] save; creatures that critically fail this saving throw are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round).
Hands of Slow Death.name: Hands of Slow Death

Hidden Bog.description: This section of grass-strewn ground hides a pool of sticky mud 10 feet across.
Hidden Bog.hazardDisable: 2 @Check[crafting|dc:15|name:Create a makeshift plank|traits:environmental] or 2 @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Create a makeshift plank|traits:environmental] to create a makeshift plank across the hidden bog; creatures can then traverse the hazard's area without stepping into the mud.
Hidden Bog.hazardReset: Creatures can still step into the mud after the trap is revealed, but the area containing the mud is obvious.
Hidden Bog.name: Hidden Bog

ve2YkqSn16RJqx9x.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

Hunting Spider (PFS 2-18).description:
Hunting spiders are the most common type of giant spider, though not the largest.

Few everyday vermin inspire as much dread as the infamous spider.

4lmj5hd20I5GvQJz.description:
Requirements Initiative has not yet been rolled.

Trigger A creature touches the hunting spider's web while the spider is on it.

Effect The hunting spider automatically notices the creature and Strides, Climbs, or Descends on a Web before it rolls initiative.
4lmj5hd20I5GvQJz.name: Spring Upon Prey

DbfLZXVZVTQMJoyI.description: The hunting spider has imprecise @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]{Tremorsense} to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its web.
DbfLZXVZVTQMJoyI.name: Web Sense

Qy7s2ZDFTvr7xR1m.description: A creature hit by the hunting spider's web attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 17).
Qy7s2ZDFTvr7xR1m.name: Web Trap

egV0y60X9Okkmuoc.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and off-guard (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and off-guard (1 round)
egV0y60X9Okkmuoc.name: Hunting Spider Venom

tHBnPDgoj9trVlBk.description:
The hunting spider moves straight down up to 40 feet, suspended by a web line. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on a Web doesn't count for falling damage.

A creature that successfully Strikes the web (AC 20, Hardness 3, 5 HP) severs it, causing the spider to fall.
tHBnPDgoj9trVlBk.name: Descend on a Web

Hunting Spider (PFS 2-18).name: Hunting Spider (PFS 2-18)

Ice Slick.description: A sheer slick of ice causes anyone other than Ssalarn who attempts to cross it to slip and fall.
Ice Slick.hazardDisable: 2 @Check[athletics|dc:18|name:Break Ice Slick|traits:environmental] to break the ice and roughen its surface
Ice Slick.name: Ice Slick

WDttWBnICVwt2mYo.description:
The dragon forest rot breathes a toxic cloud that deals @Damage[7d6[poison]] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:15] (@Check[fortitude|dc:23|basic] save).

It can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.
WDttWBnICVwt2mYo.name: Breath Weapon

On a critical failure, the creature also takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. Jinkin (PFS 2-00).description:
Jinkins are sadistic tinkers who steal and sabotage items and take great pride in their power to curse precious objects. They hold grudges and create convoluted plans for revenge whenever they feel slighted, such as when a creature dares to remove one of their curses. Rarely content to wreak simple mayhem, jinkins also take immense pleasure in torture and murder, though they prefer to lead victims into traps designed to capture or incapacitate rather than kill outright. Deep pits are favorites, since victims who survive the fall face a slow death from starvation and thirst. Jinkins enjoy gathering at the edge of pits to mock, tease, and torment.

Gremlins are cruel fey tricksters and saboteurs who have fully acclimated to life on the Material Plane, finding distinct niches for their inventive destructiveness. All gremlins delight in ruining or breaking things, whether it's something physical like a device or vehicle or something intangible such as an alliance or relationship. A gremlin's greatest joy is watching the collapse of complex creations, preferably after the lightest and slightest, carefully targeted push from the gremlin. Gremlins tend to denigrate, bully, or even slaughter their lesser kin, particularly mitflits, whom gremlins (and many others) derisively call "mites."

fHam88iT0r3U5tcl.description: A group of six jinkins can work together for an hour to imbue an item with a curse at a range of 60 feet. While this process is lengthy, it's also unobtrusive and can be performed while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hiding}. Jinkins prefer to use this ability on magic items. The curse makes the item unreliable (@Check[flat|dc:5] check or waste any action to Interact with or Activate the item), adds a bizarre requirement to use the item, or imparts some other curse of a similar caliber.
fHam88iT0r3U5tcl.name: Tinker

oObpBdGWzojxRdfS.description: The jinkin deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Kobold Warrior (PFS 2-11).description:
The typical kobold trains with agile weaponry, favoring the light pick for its use in crafting new tunnels to expand their domains through underground reaches. Kobolds are capable of landing sneaky strikes against unsuspecting foes but are just as quick to scamper off to safety when they don't, as a group, outnumber their enemies at least two to one.

Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who carry physical similarities to true dragons. They lurk in dark spaces, usually tunnels and mines beneath the earth, in either warrens of their own design or complexes discovered and colonized after the original builders have moved on. Though kobolds are far more pragmatic than they are courageous, they use every inch of their cunning to even the playing field between themselves and other, stronger creatures. They attack from the darkness and at range, and kobold artificers and engineers master the art of simple but effective traps, which they use to protect their lairs. Kobolds are skilled at working together by necessity, and they often set up ambushes or hit-and-run assaults that allow them to do the most damage possible without being harmed in return.

Kobolds are diligent and hardworking creatures, though they often turn these virtues toward selfish ends. While some kobolds live in communal collectives that maintain neutral relations with the creatures around them, they can be easily swayed into serving malevolent powers or megalomaniac leaders. This is in part due to kobolds' innate pragmatism, as they would rather concede to servitude than risk being killed, but it is also in part due to a reverence for the power that kobolds generally lack. Dragons in particular are viewed with a deferential awe, and kobolds eagerly offer their services to such mighty and glorious creatures when they can. While kobolds may scheme against other leaders, especially those that control them via subjugation, dragons are usually viewed with adoration, no matter how brutal they might be to their kobold minions.

CYklqKVJ9KZ9A4O5.description: This armor is simply a layer of heavy, quilted cloth, but it is sometimes used because it's so inexpensive. Padded armor is easier to damage and destroy than other types of armor. Heavy armor comes with a padded armor undercoat included in its Price, though it loses the comfort trait when worn under heavy armor. You can wear just that padded armor or undercoat to sleep in, if your heavy armor is destroyed, or when otherwise not wearing the full heavy armor. This allows you to keep the armor invested and benefit from the power of any runes on the associated heavy armor, but no one else can wear your heavy armor without the padded undercoat.

5hCOGBrYhgeXU2Wr.description: This armor is simply a layer of heavy, quilted cloth, but it is sometimes used because it's so inexpensive. Heavy armor comes with a padded armor undercoat included in its Price, though it loses the comfort trait when worn under heavy armor. You can wear just that padded armor or undercoat to sleep in, if your heavy armor is destroyed, or when otherwise not wearing the full heavy armor. Mutated Trollhound.description:
Trollhounds are squat, slavering beasts akin to trolls in canine form. Requiring vast quantities of meat to fuel their regenerative metabolisms, packs of wild trollhounds prowl the foothills of regions where trolls dwell, their voracious hunger driving them to slaughter and consume any prey they encounter. In some regions, trolls breed trollhounds as pets, utilizing the trollhounds' keen sense of smell to aid in the hunt.

Covered in fetid, weeping sores, trollhounds are carriers of a debilitating contagion known as bloodfire fever. Creatures that contract the disease through the bite of a trollhound experience deep internal pain, as if their blood were on fire. Additional symptoms include loss of muscle coordination, pus-filled blisters, and overall lethargy and fatigue. Other than suffering from skin irritation, both trolls and trollhounds are immune to the major effects of the disease.

Trollhounds are fearless on the hunt and in combat, relying on their ability to regenerate to carry them through. Not even the threat of fire is enough to repel them, as the beasts don't recognize the danger it represents. Nevertheless, fire is one of the most effective tools in combating trollhounds; canny hunters know to burn every last remnant of a supposedly slain trollhound, for their regenerative powers are potent indeed.

While trolls themselves have had great success in domesticating, training, and even befriending trollhounds, the same cannot be said for other would-be masters. Whether impeded by constant exposure to trollhounds' diseased slobber, their ravenous hunger that never seems to be fully sated, or simply their foul personality and quick-to-bite temperament, most attempts to use trollhounds in place of more reliable guardians end in pain, misery, and a pack of feral trollhounds escaping into the hinterlands. Left to their own devices, a pack of escaped trollhounds can breed relatively quickly, and it can take less than a year for a small pack to multiply into a significant threat to the countryside. Best to leave the trollhounds to the trolls, as they say!

Nuglub (PFS 2-00).description:
The "towering" hunchbacked nuglubs are among the largest gremlins, though they're not quite three feet tall. Nuglubs have three glowing blue eyes and black, oily hair on their head and back that covers them like a cloak. Nuglubs enjoy killing with a glee that other gremlins reserve for sabotage. Indeed, they spend long hours preparing ambushes for unwary travelers or plotting the murders of sleeping villagers. Though less technically inclined than their kin, nuglubs do enjoy building traps. They delight in stealthily constructing traps in places their victims consider familiar, such as front doors and the floors around beds. If someone else gets blamed for the mayhem the nuglub creates, all the better.

In combat, nuglubs focus on targets wearing metal armor. Some attribute this to envy on the part of the nuglubs, who find it difficult to fit armor on their twisted bodies. Nuglubs are particularly talented at causing those nearby to stumble over them and fall prone. Once an enemy falls to the ground, all the nuglubs descend upon the target, biting and scratching until nothing remains.

Nuglubs rarely gather in groups larger than half a dozen, as quarrels often lead to violence and cannibalism. A lone nuglub who bullies a group of smaller gremlins is more likely to get their way, and thus less likely to attack their allies.

FhwufRLfw0dtrKFI.name: Kneecapper

9PdSUPCOObuXj7QP.description:
Effect Perizia goads a creature into making a wish she can twist. Though Perizia isn't a noble genie and doesn't have access to the full power of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} spell, her aspirations for power and studies of wishcraft have given her a lesser ability to twist the desires of others into ruin. The creature chooses the type of wish: a wish for power, a wish for wealth, or a wish for happiness. Once the type of wish is chosen, the creature attempts a @Check[will|dc:22] save. The effects of all granted wishes end after 1 hour. After attempting a saving throw, a creature is temporarily immune to this ability for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature phrases its wish with the precision necessary to get a good outcome. The benefit it receives depends on the type of wish it made.

  • Wish for power-A burst of water empowers the creature's attacks. The creature's attacks deal an additional @Damage[1d4[bludgeoning]] damage.
  • Wish for wealth-A sack appears at the creature's waist, containing obvious fake coins and one of the following, of the creature's choice: 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.G7haQ5gDt30ftJLC]{Healing Potion (Moderate)}, 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.YHev1WJ2tOiTBg9o]{Oil of Unlife (Moderate)}, or 5 vials of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.97QyNEOAyYLdGaYc]{Bottled Lightning (Moderate)}. After 1 hour, all of these objects disappear.
  • Wish for happiness-The creature feels hopeful and inspired, gaining a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and saves against fear effects.

Success The creature resists making the wish.

Failure The creature's wish is twisted to cause it harm. The penalty it receives depends on the type of wish it made.

  • Wish for power-The creature's body is rapidly pushed to its limits of physical exertion and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.
  • Wish for wealth-The creature's pockets and bags fill with temporary treasures that resist all attempts to discard. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered}.
  • Wish for happiness-Tiny flashes of pleasant emotions and positive memories flicker across the creature's mind, interspersing with reality in a profoundly disorienting manner. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and can't reduce this condition until the effects of the wish end.

Critical Failure The creature phrases its wish poorly, and Perizia easily twists the outcome. In addition to the failure effect of the creature's chosen type of wish, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.
9PdSUPCOObuXj7QP.name: Improvised Wishcraft

6KUKMyYujA05w8AR.description: Perizia makes a trident Strike, dealing an extra @Damage[1d4[bleed]] on a hit (@Damage[2d4[bleed]] on a critical hit).
6KUKMyYujA05w8AR.name: Skewer

9PdSUPCOObuXj7QP.description:
Effect Perizia goads a creature into making a wish she can twist. Though Perizia isn't a noble genie and doesn't have access to the full power of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} spell, her aspirations for power and studies of wishcraft have given her a lesser ability to twist the desires of others into ruin. The creature chooses the type of wish: a wish for power, a wish for wealth, or a wish for happiness. Once the type of wish is chosen, the creature attempts a @Check[will|dc:26] save. The effects of all granted wishes end after 1 hour. After attempting a saving throw, a creature is temporarily immune to this ability for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature phrases its wish with the precision necessary to get a good outcome. The benefit it receives depends on the type of wish it made.

  • Wish for power-A burst of water empowers the creature's attacks. The creature's attacks deal an additional @Damage[1d4[bludgeoning]] damage.
  • Wish for wealth-A sack appears at the creature's waist, containing obvious fake coins and one of the following, of the creature's choice: 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.G7haQ5gDt30ftJLC]{Healing Potion (Moderate)}, 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.YHev1WJ2tOiTBg9o]{Oil of Unlife (Moderate)}, or 5 vials of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.97QyNEOAyYLdGaYc]{Bottled Lightning (Moderate)}. After 1 hour, all of these objects disappear.
  • Wish for happiness-The creature feels hopeful and inspired, gaining a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and saves against fear effects.

Pixie (PFS 2-00).description:
Insatiably curious, overly excitable, and just a bit puckish, pixies are wanderers and tricksters who use their pixie dust to create all sorts of whimsical situations, as well as to defend themselves. Other creatures often have trouble understanding a pixie's rapid, rambling way of speaking.

Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms "fey" or "fairy." While their dispositions vary from the benevolent grig to the trickster pixie, all sprites share a connection to magic and diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.

37UIi9bQgIaoP8cQ.description: You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.
37UIi9bQgIaoP8cQ.name: Dancing Lights

giE56Vm25ZKR3ZJm.description:
The pixie sprinkles pixie dust onto one of its arrows. If the pixie hits a creature with that arrow before the pixie's next turn, the arrow inflicts one of the following special effects instead of dealing damage. Each effect depends on the target's Will save. On a critical hit, the target treats its save result as one degree worse.

  • Charm @Check[will|dc:21|traits:emotion,enchantment,incapacitation,mental] (emotion, enchantment, incapacitation, mental) The target suffers the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} spell, except it doesn't gain a bonus to its save if the only hostile act was the pixie firing its bow, and the pixie can choose to direct the target's adoration toward another creature rather than itself.
  • Memory Loss @Check[will|dc:21|traits:divination,mental] (divination, mental) On a failed Will save, the target loses the last 5 minutes of its memory.
  • Sleep @Check[will|dc:21|traits:enchantment,incapacitation,mental,sleep] (enchantment, incapacitation, mental, sleep) The target suffers the effects of a 3rd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep} spell.
  • Subdual @Check[will|dc:21|basic|traits:enchantment,mental,nonlethal] (enchantment, mental, nonlethal) The target takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage, depending on its basic Will save.
giE56Vm25ZKR3ZJm.name: Sprinkle Pixie Dust

Pixie (PFS 2-00).name: Pixie (PFS 2-00)
Pixie (PFS 2-00).npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Plague Zombie (PFS 2-15).description:
Plague zombies are infested with hideous contagions.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

MuiyXm8KyQF57NaW.description: Requirements The zombie has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}.
MuiyXm8KyQF57NaW.name: Jaws

RhGXKyPEo0bWS5D1.description:
An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 3 1d6 void damage (1 day)

Stage 4 1d6 void damage (1 day)

Stage 5 dead, rising as a plague zombie immediately
RhGXKyPEo0bWS5D1.name: Zombie Rot

a2pZeef5wn9y5xAA.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
a2pZeef5wn9y5xAA.name: Slow

Plague Zombie (PFS 2-15).name: Plague Zombie (PFS 2-15)

Planar Cracks (5-6).description: The cracks scintillate and shift between the elemental planes, leaking perilous energy with each shift.
Planar Cracks (5-6).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:24|name:Assemble a Seal|traits:environmental,magical] (trained) twice to assemble a seal using objects strongly grounded to the Material Plane, @Check[arcana|dc:22|name:Invoke Incantations|traits:environmental,magical] (trained) twice to invoke incantations to seal the cracks, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level, counteract DC 20) to counteract the cracks.
Planar Cracks (5-6).hazardRoutine:
(1 action) A surge of energy strikes a random non-mephit creature in the foyer. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the element of the energy surge.

1-Energy from the Plane of Air: the creature takes @Damage[2d8[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:air,electricity] save); on a failure, the creature is pushed back 10 feet toward the entryway. The hazard gains the air and electricity traits for this round.

2-Energy from the Plane of Earth: the creature takes @Damage[2d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:earth] save); on a failed save, the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The hazard gains the earth trait for this round.

3-Energy from the Plane of Fire: the creature takes @Damage[(2d8+7)[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:fire] save). The hazard gains the fire trait for this round.

4-Energy from the Plane of Water: the creature takes @Damage[2d8[cold]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:water,cold] save); on a failed save, the creature's lungs fill with water, making them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. The hazard gains the cold and water traits for this round.
Planar Cracks (5-6).name: Planar Cracks (5-6)

Planar Cracks (7-8).description: The cracks scintillate and shift between the elemental planes, leaking perilous energy with each shift.
Planar Cracks (7-8).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:28|name:Assemble a Seal|traits:environmental,magical] (expert) twice to assemble a seal using objects strongly grounded to the Material Plane, @Check[arcana|dc:26|name:Invoke Incantations|traits:environmental,magical] (trained) twice to invoke incantations to seal the cracks, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th level, counteract DC 22) to counteract the cracks.
Planar Cracks (7-8).hazardRoutine:
(1 action) A surge of energy strikes a random non-mephit creature in the foyer. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the element of the energy surge.

1-Energy from the Plane of Air: the creature takes @Damage[(2d10+3)[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:air,electricity] save); on a failure, the creature is pushed back 10 feet toward the entryway. The hazard gains the air and electricity traits for this round.

2-Energy from the Plane of Earth: the creature takes @Damage[(2d10+3)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:earth] save); on a failed save, the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The hazard gains the earth trait for this round.

3-Energy from the Plane of Fire: the creature takes @Damage[(2d10+9)[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:fire] save). The hazard gains the fire trait for this round.

4-Energy from the Plane of Water: the creature takes @Damage[(2d10+3)[cold]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:water,cold] save); on a failed save, the creature's lungs fill with water, making them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}. The hazard gains the cold and water traits for this round.
Planar Cracks (7-8).name: Planar Cracks (7-8)

1ICSGdDVtFdFoByC.description: The planar nixie can use Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.1Sj2Pz3VI2SFWqZw]{Make an Impression} on and make very simple Requests of aquatic or amphibious animals and elementals.
1ICSGdDVtFdFoByC.name: Wild Empathy

8z1MC2ykPvZPeOtL.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The planar nixie can duplicate a spell of up to 2nd level, but only in response to the request or desire of a non-fey creature. The creature whose desire is granted can never again benefit from that particular planar nixie's Grant Desire ability.
8z1MC2ykPvZPeOtL.name: Grant Desire

Planar Nixie.name: Planar Nixie
Planar Nixie.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Pressurized Bottle (1-2).description: One of the potions has decayed, putting it under immense pressure. Its contents have become poisonous. When handled improperly, the bottle bursts, sending glass shards flying everywhere.
Pressurized Bottle (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:17|name:Pressurized Bottle|traits:mechanical,trap] (trained) to carefully place the bottle under a bucket or bowl.
Pressurized Bottle (1-2).name: Pressurized Bottle (1-2)

Pressurized Bottle (3-4).description: One of the potions has decayed, putting it under immense pressure. Its contents have become poisonous. When handled improperly, the bottle bursts, sending glass shards flying everywhere.
Pressurized Bottle (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Pressurized Bottle|traits:mechanical,trap] (trained) to carefully place the bottle under a bucket or bowl.
Pressurized Bottle (3-4).name: Pressurized Bottle (3-4)

Quickling (PFS 2-00).description:
Few creatures can match a quickling's speed. These malicious fey creatures delight in striking with blinding speed and accuracy, racing in to stab and slash at foes before scampering away for cover with maddening- even frightening-swiftness. Stories of people simply doubling over, bleeding from what appear to be spontaneously opening wounds, are often eyewitness accounts of quickling attacks.

Quicklings actively hate the "slow-paced dullards" they encounter every day, delighting in inflicting suffering and pain on creatures they deem too sluggish to matter. While they are related to kinder fey such as brownies and pixies, quicklings care only for their own merriment. They see their own cruel pranks as the height of humor and have full confidence that their speed and invisibility will keep them safe from harm. They occasionally form gangs of up to a dozen individuals, although the group usually devolves very quickly into mayhem, as they inevitably perform increasingly deadly pranks against each other.

3BSxL95mz6QjoWi1.description: The quickling's Strikes deal an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

TDLmq0dVU6v9wYfK.description:
Lethargy poison is commonly used in hit-and-run tactics by drow and others who want their victims alive; the ambusher retreats until the poison sets in and the victim falls unconscious. Further exposure to lethargy poison does not require the target to attempt additional saving throws; only failing an saving throw against an ongoing exposure can progress its stage.

Activate 2 Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw DC 18 Fortitude

Maximum Duration 4 hours

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 slowed 1 (1 minute)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} with no Perception check to wake up (1 round)

Stage 4 unconscious with no Perception check to wake up ([[/br 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours}).

WIPFxMzyJ87R3t7k.description: The quickling's speed, combined with nearly instantaneous acceleration and deceleration, enables them to move in astonishing ways. As long as they have a firm surface to travel across, they can Stride their full movement vertically or horizontally. They can even run across unstable surfaces, such as water, in the same way, although dangerous surfaces (acid, lava, etc.) harm them as normal. They must end their movement on a horizontal surface capable of bearing their weight or else they fall.
WIPFxMzyJ87R3t7k.name: Supernatural Speed

dynvtBdr79KGnqBo.description:
Trigger The quickling is targeted by a Strike

Effect The quickling darts aside, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC, then Strides up to half their Speed after the Strike resolves.
dynvtBdr79KGnqBo.name: Can't Catch Me

jCQO2RfqPLKqDeuF.description: The quickling takes a -2 status penalty to saving throws against effects that cause the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed} condition. If the quickling ever becomes slowed, they lose their supernatural speed, can't Fade from View, and become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} for the duration of the slow. They also can't reduce this sickened condition for the duration of the slowed effect.
jCQO2RfqPLKqDeuF.name: Slow Susceptibility

laeRdkgYSi3ibISG.description: You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.
laeRdkgYSi3ibISG.name: Dancing Lights

sNUoqbThXZbfj5S7.description:
Requirements The quickling used no attack, manipulate, or move actions in the previous round

Effect The quickling becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} until it uses an attack, manipulate, or move action.

The quickling can't use Fade from View again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Fade from View]]{1d4 rounds}.
sNUoqbThXZbfj5S7.name: Fade from View

Quickling (PFS 2-00).name: Quickling (PFS 2-00)

0VQ8msRsnI58Dzyz.description:
Requirements Qxal's last action was a successful Strike against a creature adjacent to a natural surface.

Effect Vines sprout from the surface, wrapping around the target's limbs. The creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} condition. To escape, the creature must succeed on a DC 28 Escape check or break the vines (AC 20, Hardness 4, HP 36, BT 18, weakness 10 to slashing).
0VQ8msRsnI58Dzyz.name: Cooperative Growth

2G83FlVGLWw04oTy.description: Qxal Flies. Any creature they pass within 30 feet of during their Flutter is exposed to their hallucinatory scale dust.
2G83FlVGLWw04oTy.name: Flutter

WmUvsISFLTWBCvzx.description: Qxal causes one creature within 60 feet who is under a condition from Qxal's hallucinatory scale dust aura to see visions of grasping vines and swarming insects, impeding the target's every move. All squares count as difficult terrain for that creature until the end of Qxal's next turn, and during that time they gain no benefit from any ability that would allow them to ignore difficult terrain.
WmUvsISFLTWBCvzx.name: Grasping Visions

b1geJH47XvkD5cYf.description: Qxal can pass freely through even the densest jungle. They ignore difficult terrain caused by plants, including plants manipulated by magic.
b1geJH47XvkD5cYf.name: Woodland Stride

dAAfkCznVNT1SBH9.description:
30 feet. Fey glamours shed from Qxal's wings like scale dust, causing hallucinations. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to the scale dust for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature hallucinates that it is beginning to transform into a plant or animal native to their homeland, becoming either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}, at Qxal's choice. The condition lasts for 1 hour. Each time a creature fails this save, Qxal can choose an additional condition.

Critical Failure As failure, but the condition value is 2 (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}).
dAAfkCznVNT1SBH9.name: Hallucinatory Scale Dust

mrR6xPNV4YFujksa.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet takes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

Effect The shed blood disperses into a fine mist that Qxal siphons up with their proboscis. Qxal regains [[/r 14[healing]]]{14 HP}.
mrR6xPNV4YFujksa.name: Blood Siphon

uhTOSjCBo9dPMbpa.description: Qxal knows how to disguise the manifestations of their spellcasting to catch their foes off guard. If the next action they use is Casting a Spell that has a verbal component, they can remove the verbal component. This makes the spell quieter and allows them to cast it in areas where sound can't carry. Additionally, if Qxal has cover or greater cover against or is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from one or more observers while Casting a Spell, they can attempt a @Check[stealth] check against one or more of those observers' Perception DC. If they succeed at their check against an observer's DC, that observer doesn't notice Qxal is casting a spell.
uhTOSjCBo9dPMbpa.name: Secret Spells

LUR3LU41YQgmVhQw.description: A living humanoid slain by a ragewight's claw Strike rises as a spawned wight after [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawned wight is under the command of the ragewight that killed it. It doesn't have the drain life or wight spawn abilities and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as it is a spawned wight. If the creator of the wight spawn dies, the wight spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wight; it regains its free will, gains the drain life and wight spawn abilities, and is no longer clumsy.
LUR3LU41YQgmVhQw.name: Wight Spawn

NsZlYqlD0rycOyOo.description:
Trigger A creature uses a move action to leave a square adjacent to the ragewight

Effect The ragewight attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the target.
NsZlYqlD0rycOyOo.name: Furious Grab

P90FbI0EgIg4Jd24.description:
The ragewight goes into a frenzy, gaining 8 temporary Hit Points. Its Strikes deal 2 additional damage, and it takes a -1 penalty to AC.

This lasts for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Rage}
P90FbI0EgIg4Jd24.name: Rage

f42OKdvtvGvdcunj.description: When the ragewight damages a living creature with its claw Strike, the ragewight gains 3 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt to the creature by the ragewight increases the amount of drain by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.
f42OKdvtvGvdcunj.name: Drain Life

This spawned wight is under the command of the ragewight that killed it. It doesn't have the drain life or wight spawn abilities and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as it is a spawned wight. If the creator of the wight spawn dies, the wight spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wight; it regains its free will, gains the drain life and wight spawn abilities, and is no longer clumsy.

NsZlYqlD0rycOyOo.description:
Trigger A creature uses a move action to leave a square adjacent to the ragewight

Effect The ragewight attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the target.

P90FbI0EgIg4Jd24.description:
The ragewight goes into a frenzy, gaining 10 temporary Hit Points. Its Strikes deal 2 additional damage, and it takes a -1 penalty to AC.

This lasts for 1 minute.

After the Strike, the shark splashes back down into the water.

Like normal objects, the animated guardian has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once the animated guardian is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 13. It also loses its hardness.

Relive the Rending (1-2).description: The room shakes violently, as it did during the Rending, and the spirits of dozens of dwarves make a mad dash for safety, their terror palpable.
Relive the Rending (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:18|name:Calm the Spirits|traits:unique,complex,haunt], @Check[intimidation|dc:18|name:Calm the Spirits|traits:unique,complex,haunt], or @Check[religion|dc:18|name:Calm the Spirits|traits:unique,complex,haunt] to calm the panicked spirits, or @Check[athletics|dc:20|name:Wrestle Spirits into Order|traits:unique,complex,haunt] to wrestle them into a semblance of order. Two successful checks are required to deactivate the haunt, and each attempt requires two actions.
Relive the Rending (1-2).hazardReset: Unless deactivated, the haunt deactivates 1 minute after all creatures leave the area but resets immediately thereafter. If deactivated, the haunt resets after 24 hours.
Relive the Rending (1-2).hazardRoutine:
(1 action) Phantom dwarves trample toward the exit, dealing @Damage[(1d10+4)[bludgeoning]] damage to each living creature in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|name:Trampled by Spirits|traits:complex,haunt,unique] save). On a critical failure, a creature is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

A creature that attempts to Stand after being inside the haunt's area must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11] check or else get knocked back down by the trampling spirits.

Saddleback Bunyip.description:
Bunyips are dangerous aquatic predators that resemble a cross between a shark and a seal. Found in freshwater inlets or saltwater coves worldwide, bunyips hunt where prey is plentiful, often to the consternation of coastal residents and fisherfolk.

Despite their outlandish appearance and tendency to defend their territory with loud, bellowing roars that echo for great distances, bunyips are very rarely sighted by humanoids, leaving many to question their existence. For hundreds of years, bunyips were widely regarded as nothing more than folk tales, and even now that their existence as a species has been proven, the existence of any particular bunyip in a local area is often met with heavy skepticism. While their limited shapechanging abilities are no doubt a significant part of the reason for this air of mystery, another major factor is that the aquatic creatures rarely hunt humanoids, preferring to eat smaller animals. Most bunyips avoid human contact, except when one wanders too close to their den or favorite hunting spot, at which point the territorial bunyip attacks with swift and terrible ferocity. Many scholars agree that a large number of unexplained disappearances near coastal areas are the result of unreported bunyip aggression.

In some ports, bunyips have learned that delicious prizes can be had from the chum and garbage discarded by fishing boats and merchant vessels. They lurk close to the shore and carefully choose their victims, plucking them off docks and small boats. These bunyips are particularly careful to keep their true forms hidden, but this does little to dull rumors of monster-infested waters.

4WwWjUOGDnJncjWj.description: As @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]{Attack of Opportunity}, but both the bunyip and the triggering creature must be in water.
4WwWjUOGDnJncjWj.name: Aquatic Opportunity

4wMDNNrvnJFAi5UI.description:
Requirements The bunyip is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy.

Trigger The bunyip deals bleed damage to a living creature.

Effect The bunyip flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the bunyip gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its jaws, gains 8 temporary HP that go away at the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 penalty to AC.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.ScZ8tlV5zS0Jwnqn]{Effect: Blood Frenzy}
4wMDNNrvnJFAi5UI.name: Blood Frenzy

bdrrSnIH32ERMP25.description: The bunyip lets out a loud and horrifying roar. Other creatures within 100 feet must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} on a success, or unaffected on a critical success). No matter the result, the creature is temporarily immune to the effect for 1 minute.
bdrrSnIH32ERMP25.name: Roar

i8xGkDyTBirx7HaW.description: The bunyip can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.
i8xGkDyTBirx7HaW.name: Blood Scent

yFqMLM1iygDqwiZC.description: A bunyip can alter its form slightly to gain an advantage and make it harder to recognize. When it does, its teeth shrink and its Jaws Strike doesn't deal the 1d6 persistent bleed damage. It can choose to gain either a long snake tail, granting its tail Strike reach 10 feet and Grab, or squat crocodile legs, increasing its land Speed to 20 feet. If it uses Shift Form again, the bunyip can return to normal or switch between a long tail or crocodile legs.
yFqMLM1iygDqwiZC.name: Shift Form

Saddleback Bunyip.name: Saddleback Bunyip

Scorched Cavern Troll.description:
Insatiable scavengers stalking the eternal gloom of the Darklands, cavern trolls consume all in their path-even rocks and minerals when more nourishing sustenance is scarce. These rocky goliaths can tunnel through stone with their iron-sharp claws.

Cavern trolls rarely venture to the surface world, for they have a debilitating vulnerability to sunlight that petrifies them on sustained contact. Unlike common trolls, cavern trolls can regenerate wounds dealt by fire. The crystalline nature of their skin, however, permits sonic attacks to neutralize their signature regeneration.

As cavern trolls age, their flinty skin becomes studded with small crystals and stones of various composition. Paragons of their kind have toothy maws replete with large, crystalline fangs. A typical cavern troll stands 14 feet in height and weighs about 2,000 pounds.

82mYFvhHNCVY8VhZ.description: If exposed to direct sunlight, a cavern troll immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions or Trample. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the cavern troll ends its turn in sunlight. If the cavern troll's actions are reduced to 0 in this way, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} until they spends at least 1 minute in darkness. Spells like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.a3aQxCpoj1q1NQxC]{Sunburst} that create magical sunlight cannot petrify a cavern troll, but the troll is slowed 1 for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} after being exposed to such an effect.
82mYFvhHNCVY8VhZ.name: Sunlight Petrification

Wuf9DlYpWzZIh7S0.description: A cavern troll can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 10 feet. It can leave a tunnel if it desires.
Wuf9DlYpWzZIh7S0.name: Rock Tunneler

Given a choice, an aghash attacks a foe with the highest Charisma score first. If barred from doing so by force or some magical effect, they take @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage at the end of their turn
8OYkfX1SGDuogKYz.name: Hatred of Beauty

Success The creature takes @Damage[2d4[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d4[mental]] damage and becomes either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (the aghash's choice).

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d4[mental]] damage and becomes Frightened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.
RltonTctqXIM2FmD.name: Cursed Gaze

taMiq6FtqyhO2Kij.description:
The Usij cultists' blood magic strengthens Sezruth. He begins with 2 Blood Points from sacrifices just before the PCs arrived, and gains 1 additional Blood Point for each time the empowered blood hazard is activated in area B. The adjustments are not cumulative.

1-2 Blood Points Sezruth gains 5 temporary Hit Points.

3-4 Blood Points Sezruth gains 5 temporary Hit Points. Sezruth is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1} and can use the extra action to Stride toward or Strike the foe it is aware of with the highest Charisma score.

5 or more Blood Points Sezruth gains 10 temporary Hit Points. Sezruth is quickened 1 and can use the extra action to Stride toward or Strike the foe it is aware of with the highest Charisma score
taMiq6FtqyhO2Kij.name: Empowered Blood

Sezruth (1-2).name: Sezruth (1-2)
Sezruth (1-2).npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

8LvW9ugfS2Sd2sxJ.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The aghash creates a temporary sandstorm in a 30-foot emanation that lasts for 5 rounds. Creatures within the emanation take a -4 circumstance penalty to Perception checks and must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save. On a failure, they're forced to hold their breath or else they start suffocating. A creature within the sandstorm at the end of its turn takes @Damage[1d10[slashing]] damage. Divs are immune to all effects of an aghash's sandstorm
8LvW9ugfS2Sd2sxJ.name: Sandstorm

8OYkfX1SGDuogKYz.description: While aghashes hate all mortals, they particularly despise beautiful objects and beautiful or charismatic mortals. When not in physical peril, an aghash is compelled to destroy art and other works of beauty. An aghash can't enter an area of pristine beauty without first marring it in some way. Given a choice, an aghash attacks a foe with the highest Charisma score first. If barred from doing so by force or some magical effect, they take @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage at the end of their turn
8OYkfX1SGDuogKYz.name: Hatred of Beauty

Trigger A creature adjacent to Silaqui successfully hits her with a Strike.

Effect The attacker takes @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save) as they are battered by high-pressure water currents.
0XHcgxkgDqsXBxpu.name: Curse of the Spiraling Maelstrom

0XHcgxkgDqsXBxpu.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to Silaqui successfully hits her with a Strike.

Sinkhole.description: An assortment of leaves and loose dirt cover a sudden drop in elevation.
Sinkhole.hazardDisable: @Check[nature|dc:12|name:Uncover Sinkhole|traits:environmental] to remove the covering foliage
Sinkhole.name: Sinkhole

6sY4dsXDk7ijJRT6.description: Half plate consists of most of the upper body plates used in full plate, with lighter or sparser steel plate protection for the arms and legs. This provides some of the protection of full plate with greater flexibility and speed. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of padded armor and a pair of gauntlets.

IJWwhJN9hAWZSUST.description: The skeleton Strides and makes a claw Strike with a +4 circumstance bonus to damage circumstance bonus to damage. If the strike hits, the skeleton attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.nEwqNNWX6scLt4sc]{Demoralize: Intimidation} the target.
IJWwhJN9hAWZSUST.name: Terrifying Charge

b65tWh6PV9j81yq3.description:
This long bone functions as a Bo Staff.

This strong but slender staff is tapered at the ends and well balanced. It's designed to be an offensive and defensive weapon.
b65tWh6PV9j81yq3.name: Long Bone

ywp4JyHQAVo3iLhj.description: When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released. Adjacent creatures take @Damage[2d6[slashing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save
ywp4JyHQAVo3iLhj.name: Explosive Death

zZhXDr0O3nKNwMa4.description: The skeleton makes two Strikes with its bo staff against two adjacent foes, both of whom are within its reach. The multiple attack penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.
zZhXDr0O3nKNwMa4.name: Broad Swipe

Sliding Statue (1-2).description: With a rumble, this statue of a former Pathfinder slides across the schoolyard. Its legs pump up and down as it advances.
Sliding Statue (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[athletics|dc:20|name:Hold Back Statue|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] to hold it back, @Check[crafting|dc:17|name:Break Statue|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to break the statue by exploiting a flaw, @Check[occultism|dc:16|name:Dispel Planar Energies|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to dispel the planar energies.
Sliding Statue (1-2).hazardRoutine: (3 actions) The trap uses its three actions for its Trample activity.
Sliding Statue (1-2).name: Sliding Statue (1-2)

Sliding Statue (3-4).description: With a rumble, this statue of a former Pathfinder slides across the schoolyard. Its legs pump up and down as it advances.
Sliding Statue (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[athletics|dc:23|name:Hold Back Statue|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] to hold it back, @Check[crafting|dc:20|name:Break Statue|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to break the statue by exploiting a flaw, @Check[occultism|dc:18|name:Dispel Planar Energies|traits:complex,hazard,magical,trap] (trained) to dispel the planar energies.
Sliding Statue (3-4).hazardRoutine: (3 actions) The trap uses its three actions for its Trample activity.
Sliding Statue (3-4).name: Sliding Statue (3-4)

6wqlMRJBrC4YDbIM.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Disease

HbaBlixSGEIgGNof.description: The opossum Strides up to half its speed. It can pass through other creatures' spaces during this movement, though it must end its movement in an unoccupied space.
HbaBlixSGEIgGNof.name: Scurry Underfoot

mGV6qaFmC4B3ur80.description:
Trigger The opossum is reduced below 15 HP

Effect The opossum collapses. It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} and can use actions that require only its mind, but any other action ends the ruse. A successful @Check[perception|dc:16|name:See Through Feign Death|traits:action:seek] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} or @Check[medicine|dc:16|name:See Through Feign Death|traits:action:recall-knowledge] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} is required to determine that the animal is not, in fact, dead.
mGV6qaFmC4B3ur80.name: Feign Death

ygNOHtGxR72hMDBw.description:
Trigger The opossum is attacked or disturbed by a creature within reach while Feigning Death

Effect The opossum Strikes the triggering creature.
ygNOHtGxR72hMDBw.name: Revived Retaliation

Small Opossum.name: Small Opossum
Small Opossum.npcAllSaves: +2 circumstance to all saves vs. disease

5 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save.

Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to for 1 minute.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

32sJ45kKGClodunO.name: Smoldering Stench

5oauJ9Fciow42Wnn.description: Solvatar can Recall Knowledge on any subject with a +7 modifier.
5oauJ9Fciow42Wnn.name: Bardic Lore

EOzNUSuV9na9Exal.name: Lightning Blast

R5zztXABMO2mtYBr.description:
Trigger The spark troll would take sonic damage

Effect The spark troll redirects hazardous sonic vibrations to another target within 30 feet. The spark troll gains resistance 5 against the triggering damage, and their chosen target must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:16] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
R5zztXABMO2mtYBr.name: Sonic Redirection

EOzNUSuV9na9Exal.description: The spark troll calls lightning down from the sky, then redirects it out from their hands in a @Template[line|distance:40]. Creatures in the line take @Damage[2d4[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save).
EOzNUSuV9na9Exal.name: Lightning Blast

g1Zb6J7WyswNWBwe.description:
Trigger The spark troll would take sonic damage

Effect The spark troll redirects hazardous sonic vibrations to another target within 30 feet. The spark troll gains resistance 5 against the triggering damage, and their chosen target must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:17] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
g1Zb6J7WyswNWBwe.name: Sonic Redirection

8JUE6Z13hTUpIAbJ.description:
The tatzlwyrm belches a puff of frigid vapor into the face of an adjacent creature, which must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:15|traits:damaging-effect] save; the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to this save if it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}. The tatzlwyrm can't use Gelid Breath again for 2 rounds.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round.

Failure The target takes @Damage[2d6[cold]] damage and is clumsy 1 for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[cold]] damage and is clumsy 1 for 1 minute.
8JUE6Z13hTUpIAbJ.name: Gelid Breath

idkdIpTpMENK2eFu.description: Ssalarn's white and blue scales provide natural camouflage. In areas of snow and ice, Ssalarn can move at his full Speed when Sneaking, and he gains a +4 circumstance bonus to Hide.
idkdIpTpMENK2eFu.name: Natural Camouflage

Hsh9yw0IW6kN2n8t.description:
Trigger An adjacent creature deals piercing or slashing damage to the sea drake

Effect An arc of electricity courses through the sea drake's blood. The triggering creature takes @Damage[1d6[electricity]] damage.
Hsh9yw0IW6kN2n8t.name: Electrified Blood

gBFFibeJFk4MB72C.description: The sea drake makes one jaws Strike and two tail Strikes in any order.
gBFFibeJFk4MB72C.name: Draconic Frenzy

hTuKXeGWvUSUobx7.description:
The sea drake spews a ball of electricity that strikes a primary target within 100 feet, dealing @Damage[6d6[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save). The lightning then arcs to up to three secondary targets within 30 feet of the primary target, striking the closest available targets first. The secondary bolts each strike one secondary target and deal the same rolled damage value as the primary bolt (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save).

The sea drake can't use Ball Lightning Breath again for [[/br 1d6 #Recharge Ball Lightning Breath]]{1d6 rounds}.
hTuKXeGWvUSUobx7.name: Ball Lightning Breath

iWYCpNJjdadjk8JX.description:
A sea drake's saliva carries a large quantity of salt, making its bite wounds even more painful. When a creature takes damage from a sea drake's jaws Strike, the creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save; the creature is then temporarily immune to briny wound for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is Sickened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened.
iWYCpNJjdadjk8JX.name: Briny Wound

Sticky Web Lurker Noose.description: Discreet webbing at throat level snags a creature that walks into it.
Sticky Web Lurker Noose.name: Sticky Web Lurker Noose

Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).description: A ghostly host of god callers and their eidolons manifests to defend the barrow against intruders, and the strains of a battle song fill the air.
Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[deception|dc:22] to appear to be a defender of Storasta, @Check[diplomacy|dc:22] to demonstrate benign intentions, or @Check[occultism|dc:20] or @Check[religion|dc:20] to ward off the malevolent spiritual energies. Two successful checks are required to disable the haunt, and each attempt requires two actions.
Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).hazardReset: The haunt dissipates 1 minute after all living creatures leave area C1. Its spiritual energies re-form after 24 hours.
Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).hazardRoutine: (1 action) (illusion, mental, occult) The haunt attacks what it believes is a demonic incursion, dealing @Damage[(1d8+3)[mental],1d8[good]]{1d8+3 mental and 1d8 good damage} to each living creature in the area (@Check[will|dc:21|basic|name:Storasta's Last Stand|traits:illusion,mental,occult] save).
Storasta's Last Stand (3-4).name: Storasta's Last Stand (3-4)

Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).description: A ghostly host of god callers and their eidolons manifests to defend the barrow against intruders, and the strains of a battle song fill the air.
Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).hazardDisable: @Check[deception|dc:25] to appear to be a defender of Storasta, @Check[diplomacy|dc:25] to demonstrate benign intentions, or @Check[occultism|dc:22] or @Check[religion|dc:22] to ward off the malevolent spiritual energies. Two successful checks are required to disable the haunt, and each attempt requires two actions.
Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).hazardReset: The haunt dissipates 1 minute after all living creatures leave area C1. Its spiritual energies re-form after 24 hours.
Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).hazardRoutine: (1 action) (illusion, mental, occult) The haunt attacks what it believes is a demonic incursion, dealing @Damage[(1d8+9)[mental]] damage and @Damage[1d8[good]] damage to each living creature in the area (@Check[will|dc:24|basic|name:Storasta's Last Stand] save).
Storasta's Last Stand (5-6).name: Storasta's Last Stand (5-6)

r8cgU9xUWcrYwZxc.description:
Trigger The storm bear is targeted by, or in the area of, an effect that deals electricity damage

Effect The storm bear devours some of the electricity to fuel a quick burst of speed, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round. While quickened, the storm bear's motions produce visible sparks of electricity.
r8cgU9xUWcrYwZxc.name: Consume Lightning

rjEjl4EfYDSqvrBQ.description:
The storm bear unleashes a deafening roar. Any non-storm bear creature within 10 feet takes @Damage[2d6[sonic]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:17|basic] save); creatures that critically fail this save are deafened for [[/br 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds}.

The storm bear can't use Thunderous Roar again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Thunderous Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.
rjEjl4EfYDSqvrBQ.name: Thunderous Roar

e3RlQHfH1zTKEKwf.description:

The storm bear can't use Thunderous Roar again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Thunderous Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.
e3RlQHfH1zTKEKwf.name: Thunderous Roar

qITipsKZASBgK8d2.name: Consume Lightning

0huK4tVOXnDh73XE.description: A formula book holds the formulas necessary to make items other than the common equipment from this chapter; alchemists typically get one for free. Each formula book can hold the formulas for up to 100 different items. Formulas can also appear on parchment sheets, tablets, and almost any other medium; there's no need for you to copy them into a specific book as long as you can keep them on hand to reference them.
0huK4tVOXnDh73XE.name: Formula Book

7apC2gXmhz4Tuzd1.description:
Activate A Interact

Elixirs of life accelerate a living creatures natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain [[/r (3d6+6)[healing]]]{3d6+6 Hit Points} and gain +1 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.EpB7yJPEuG6ez4z3]{Effect: Elixir of Life (Lesser)}
7apC2gXmhz4Tuzd1.name: Elixir of Life (Lesser) [Infused]

7p1XussSqwcfWn2E.description:
Activate A Interact

With a sharp twist of this item, you instantly create a screen of thick, opaque smoke in a burst centered on one corner of your space. All creatures within that area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

The radius of the burst is 20 feet.
7p1XussSqwcfWn2E.name: Smokestick (Greater) [Infused]

AAot6LC81mrQcnMK.description: Strak carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours, or until the next time he makes his daily preparations: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{Elixir of Life (Lesser)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Acid Flask (Moderate)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)} (9), and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ehss8yPTXxiUdVlJ]{Smokestick (Greater)}.

Stranded Melody (5-6).description: Planar winds summoned from beyond sweep through the room, song and sound carried adrift on their current. This air elemental is trapped on the Material Plane and can't escape.
Stranded Melody (5-6).hazardDisable: @Check[performance|dc:24|name:Duplicate the Melody|traits:environmental,magical] (expert) twice to duplicate the melody and appease the elemental, or @Check[arcana|dc:27|name:Guide the Elemental|traits:environmental,magical] (expert) and then @Check[diplomacy|dc:24|name:Guide the Elemental|traits:environmental,magical] (trained) to guide the elemental through a planar tear elsewhere in the manor. Each attempt to Disable the hazard requires two actions, and each successful check to Disable removes one action from the hazard's routine.
Stranded Melody (5-6).hazardReset: The melody remains for 1 minute, after which it disperses into several holes in the walls. It returns after an hour unless disabled.
Stranded Melody (5-6).hazardRoutine: (2 actions) For each action in the routine, the melody makes a solid refrain Strike against one creature in its area. This trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Stranded Melody (5-6).name: Stranded Melody (5-6)

oAqUayimlzZFsEF0.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.
oAqUayimlzZFsEF0.name: Religious Symbol of Zon-Kuthon (Wooden)

K9DEiC1oIoqDWUwg.description:
Tewakam points out a weakness of a creature within 30 feet. Tewakam and all allies that can hear or see him gain a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls against that creature until the beginning of Tewakam's next turn. Tewakam adds an extra 1d4 precision damage to his weapon and unarmed attacks that hit that creature during the duration.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uqjx1bwYduHwwC7d]{Effect: Guiding Words}

cyw0PQ9OsauAO56c.description: This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often "bearded", having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.

ggo8dEkNuvsu7eRM.description:

Hrf4HbW0m1p6hHhY.name: Shark Commune 150 feet

wZTyTWJia1mgnQH1.description:
Requirements The sea devil is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy

Trigger The sea devil deals bleed damage to a living creature.

Effect The sea devil flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the sea devil gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with its claws and jaws, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its claws and jaws, gains 15 temporary HP until the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. The sea devil can't voluntarily stop its frenzy. After its frenzy, the sea devil is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

The Scholar of Sorts (1-2).description:
Akizendris gnaw at sources of knowledge and lore, gleefully corrupting and altering them to vex scholars and sages across the planes with contradictions and untruths. These proteans appear as cackling, serpentine creatures with elongated crocodilian faces, luminous eyes, and arms that vanish at the elbows into swirling clouds of runes before reforming into solid talons.

Akizendris amuse themselves by rearranging or deleting texts, placing insulting acrostics in poetic verses, and penning crude insults upon title pages. Libraries in such places as Heaven, Axis, and Hell are especially keen to avoid such contamination, knowing that their records are choice targets for every akizendri in existence.

3WqEPpUcLFd5pJv6.description:
An akizendri's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the Scholar takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The Scholar is immune to polymorph effects unless they are a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the Scholar automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.
3WqEPpUcLFd5pJv6.name: Protean Anatomy 6

OJm7rYI5Ruon3nTT.description:
Requirements The Scholar is adjacent to a text they have modified with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VVAZPCvd4d90qVA1]{Secret Page}, and another such text is within 500 feet

Effect The Scholar has a way with words beyond other akizendris. They physically immerse themself into the adjacent text, which they use as a medium to teleport to another text within 500 feet that they have modified with secret page. Once they enter the first text, they instantly know the locations of the other texts within range.

Entering a text in this manner automatically dispels the secret page effect on it, but not the secret page effect on the destination text. The locations of the Scholar's modified texts are marked on the map.
OJm7rYI5Ruon3nTT.name: Text Passage

nIDe1OaPgWDPyBej.description:
When the Scholar casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VVAZPCvd4d90qVA1]{Secret Page}, it can physically immerse itself in the text, changing the message of the text in the process. It can exit the book at any point by Dismissing secret page, at which point it appears in a space adjacent to the text. If it does so to begin combat, it rolls a Deception check for initiative.

As long as it remains immersed in the text, the Scholar has no body. It can communicate telepathically with a creature as long as the creature touches the book or scroll that contains the secret page. It can sense nearby creatures using its entropy sense, but not in any other way, nor can it use any attack, manipulate, or move actions or speak aloud. If the object they are immersed in is destroyed, the Scholar reappears in an adjacent square and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.
nIDe1OaPgWDPyBej.name: Text Immersion

rB0kJuC158tvKsmj.description:
A creature hit by the Scholar's bite Strike must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20] save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.
rB0kJuC158tvKsmj.name: Garbled Thoughts

tH3f4GsDerHRNPik.description:
The Scholar takes on the appearance of any Small or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

um06dCu0E8W9LRDd.description: An akizendri can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the Scholar the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.
um06dCu0E8W9LRDd.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet

The Scholar of Sorts (1-2).name: The Scholar of Sorts (1-2)

j3ELc14hlrOyqOK9.description:
Trigger The leaded skeleton is hit by a melee attack

Effect A cloud of lead dust is released, forming a @Template[burst|distance:5]{5-foot radius} cloud of fine particles surrounding the skeleton. The cloud persists for 1 round, exposing creatures within it to an inhaled form of rapid lead poison.
j3ELc14hlrOyqOK9.name: Lead Cloud

mTwyXddJq3vxuscO.description:
High amounts of lead can cause headache, difficulty concentrating, and joint pain. Necromantic magic has augmented the lead that infuses this skeleton, causing it to take effect far more quickly than is typical for lead poisoning.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage,@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, stupefied 1, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (2 rounds)
mTwyXddJq3vxuscO.name: Rapid Lead Poison

6wqlMRJBrC4YDbIM.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Disease

HbaBlixSGEIgGNof.description: The opossum Strides up to half its speed. It can pass through other creatures' spaces during this movement, though it must end its movement in an unoccupied space.
HbaBlixSGEIgGNof.name: Scurry Underfoot

mGV6qaFmC4B3ur80.description:
Trigger The opossum is reduced below 15 HP

Effect The opossum collapses. It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} and can use actions that require only its mind, but any other action ends the ruse. A successful @Check[perception|dc:18|name:See Through Feign Death|traits:action:seek] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} or @Check[medicine|dc:18|name:See Through Feign Death|traits:action:recall-knowledge] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} is required to determine that the animal is not, in fact, dead.
mGV6qaFmC4B3ur80.name: Feign Death

ygNOHtGxR72hMDBw.description:
Trigger The opossum is attacked or disturbed by a creature within reach while Feigning Death

Effect The opossum Strikes the triggering creature.
ygNOHtGxR72hMDBw.name: Revived Retaliation

Tough Small Opossum.name: Tough Small Opossum
Tough Small Opossum.npcAllSaves: +2 circumstance to all saves vs. disease

Twigjack (PFS 2-08).description:
Maladjusted forest denizens, twigjacks form from the cruel and prankish combination of fey and the very woods in which they reside. A twigjack's body is made up of prickly brambles woven with vines. Shaggy, mossy growth, not unlike hair, tops a twigjack's head. Its mouth is just a canyon of splintered and broken sticks bisecting its face. Leaves and sprigs of new growth randomly sprout from the creature's body. Many dense forests on Golarion have at least a handful of twigjacks living in the undergrowth.

While truculent and violent, twigjacks care deeply for what they consider to be their forests. These creatures harass outsiders who delve deep into their wooded domains, forcing back even the most determined explorers, foresters, and travelers, especially when those intruders cut roads through the forest. However, they are not terribly territorial when it comes to other forest creatures. When sylvan creatures, especially fey, rally against an outside threat, twigjacks in the area eagerly arrive to fight, even if they were not invited.

Less seasoned travelers who encounter twigjacks in their canopied homes often mistake them for leshys, a tendency that frustrates twigjacks, as they have a low opinion of such creatures. More broadly, twigjacks resent being considered mere animated plants at all. Rather, they embrace their fey heritage-often to a foolish end. Twigjacks go out of their way to ingratiate themselves to the fey creatures they live among. Several popular comic songs weave the tale of a twigjack attempting to woo a powerful and graceful dryad, only to be comically disgraced after many loutish attempts. Many fey seem embarrassed by these strange cousins, but some spriggans, quicklings, and redcaps harness the twigjacks' violent urges and disruptive behavior for their own purposes.

While twigjacks are fey, and as such are often found in the First World, it's somewhat curious that those twigjacks who find religion only rarely turn to the Eldest of the First World. Instead, twigjacks tend to worship false deities of their own design: figures spotted in tangles of tree branches, clots of undergrowth, or other hidden nooks in the natural world. These religions are always highly localized, and while these faiths do not support clerics, they often inspire zealous crusades against non-fey.

dOcDYCNGkTD6GGcZ.description:
The twigjack sprays a barrage of splinters and brambles from its body in a @Template[cone|distance:15], dealing @Damage[4d6[piercing]] damage(@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save).

It can't use Splinter Spray again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Splinter Spray]]{1d4 rounds}.
dOcDYCNGkTD6GGcZ.name: Splinter Spray

Twigjack (PFS 2-08).name: Twigjack (PFS 2-08)

Unkillable Zombie Shambler.description:
A zombie shambler is a slow-moving horror dangerous in larger groups.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

eulyI60JHNUYs39w.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
eulyI60JHNUYs39w.name: Slow

Unstable Ice.hazardDisable: 2 @Check[athletics|dc:19|name:Move Ice|traits:environmental] to move the ice sheets into a more stable position
Unstable Ice.name: Unstable Ice

3Eksrmh390T4SrP7.description: Urkhas is immune to all spells except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Revealing Light}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Quandary}, and spells with the good trait.

F8xpT7h5a5ZviXU5.description:
Requirements An enemy is being affected by a fear effect or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} within 15 feet of the will-o'-wisp.

Effect Urkhas feeds on the creature's terror. It regains [[/r 1d4[healing]]] Hit Points, and if it has Gone Dark, its glow reignites.

Urkhas can take this action only once per round.
F8xpT7h5a5ZviXU5.name: Feed on Fear

USCoVo5LJNs12zB4.description: Urkhas extinguishes its glow, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. It can end this effect with another use of this action. If it uses its shock attack while invisible, the arc of electricity lets any observer determine its location, making the Urkhas only @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to all observers until it moves.
USCoVo5LJNs12zB4.name: Go Dark

wChn2PEw9GYziq2n.description: 20 feet. Urkhas is itself naturally invisible, but glows with a violet light, casting bright light in the aura and making it visible.
wChn2PEw9GYziq2n.name: Glow

Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

XbTD7oBK1dYTt4M9.description:
Trigger The Usij acolyte is reduced to 0 Hit Points, and the acolyte can see or hear a div within 60 feet

Effect The Usij Acolyte makes a melee Strike before dying.
XbTD7oBK1dYTt4M9.name: Death Frenzy

XbTD7oBK1dYTt4M9.description:
Trigger The Usij cultist is reduced to 0 Hit Points, and the cultist can see or hear a div within 60 feet

Effect The Usij cultist makes a melee Strike before dying.
